Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations”
Reviews.Author: jdhallchgo
Reviews.Content: The two-room suite was nice and clean and in good repair. However, the common areas of the floors are in need of updating. The hotel staff were cordial and friendly. The breakfast buffet was standard with the made-to-order omelettes being the only highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Al L
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel in the heart of New Orleans' Warehouse District and only 1 block away from the Convention Center. It's close to good restaurants (eg. Lucy's, Rock N Sake, Cochon, Emeril's) and museums (eg. WWII Museum, Children's Museum, Civil War Museum). All within walking distance. The lobby and adjacent dining area are spacious with an interesting Mardi Gras mural on the main wall. I enjoyed staring at that thing and finding the peculiar little details. They also have a restaurant in the hotel but I did not dine there. The staff were all very friendly, courteous, and helpful, especially the bellman and the parking valets. The room was what you would expect from an Embassy Suites, although a tad bit smaller, but still very comfortable (comfy bed, crisp sheets, warm comforter). Everything was clean and well-maintained with only one minor exception: the shower did not produce hot water, only lukewarm water. The Manager's Reception was very popular with all the guests, serving cocktails, beer, and wine all for free! The breakfast was also well-stocked and they even provided a cook-to-order service, also for free (just like any other Embassy Suites). All in all, I give this hotel high marks for location, beautiful lobby area, comfortable rooms/bedding, breakfast, and a jubilant Manager's Reception. The only low marks: $30 for parking per night (all hotels in the city will charge this) and a lukewarm shower.

Reviews.Title: “This is our New Orleans home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn A
Reviews.Content: Our son is a senior at Tulane University and we have been staying at this Embassy Suites ever since we started looking at colleges when he was a sophomore in high school. We enjoy everything about this location...the people are wonderful, thoughtful and attentive. It's a great location and the suite style rooms give him a place to stay with us when we visit and he can get away from campus for a few days without all of us being in one room the whole time. The valet parking is worth the price; our car is safe & secure and the attendants know you by name (and remember it!) from the first time you meet them. The breakfast is outstanding and the atmosphere is fantastic. We prefer the Lofts rooms but if our kids were still young I would prefer the main hotel as that is where the pool, restaurant, etc. is located. We just stayed there last weekend to move our son in for his last year at Tulane while Hurricane Isaac was working it's way up the coast and everyone down to the men hanging the sheeting over the windows when we checked out were as concerned about his preparedness and our safety as they were their own.

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't bad, but...”
Reviews.Author: geedbee
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New Orleans as a family and I thought this was the best place to stay as Embassy Suites are generally the same and I kinda knew what to expect. The main differences were that there was no self parking available. You had to use the hotels parking lot and you had to pay $30 a night to park there. Although you could park on the street there were meters and as we were new in town we did not want to get a ticket, we asked the dfront desk staff and none of them seemed to know how the meters worked. Several people in my famiky had handixcapped placards and they did not know if there was handicapped parking at the meters nor was there any discount for parking in the lot. To me, this seemed like something the front desk staff should know, but perhaps I was expected too much. You were given tickets when you checked in and you had to bring those rickets down to breakfast each morning. Wthout them you could not eat as they were collected by a very pleasant lady each morning. Breakfast was the usual fare, but the gentleman cook cooked grits better than the lady cook and he seemed more at ease in the kitchen than she did. This Embassy Suites only exceeded the others in which I have stayed because of the staff. Brandon and Ricky seemed to truly liked their jobs and if they did not they were really good at faking it. They were knowledgeable, personable, friendly and welcoming. I felt as if they were old family friends. They made the trip enjoyable with their suggestions and knowledge. The front desk staff was friendly eough but not overly so. There were two people at the concierge desk, a man and a woman. I dealt with both of them. DeMarcus (I beleive was his name) was very firendly when were were discussing the rour of the city. The lady--not so much. She managed to make me feel as if I was bothering her or that she had something better to do than answer my questions. We did eat in the restaurant in the hotel and the food was good, but I did not know how to take our server Charles, he rolled his eyes at our questions, had a smart answer to some of our queastions and actesd like we were disturbing him, but by the end of the meal it was okay. I guess he had not encountered anyone like us in his restaurant. I will admit, we can be a handfull but I'm not sure that his behavior was okay until we had at least established some kind of relationship. It was a bit off putting at first, but all well that ends well. As I said it all turned out fine and our meal came out as we requested. Our room was clean and while I did not pull out the couch bed (too lazy) I did sleep on the couch, it was comfortable enough. The beds, according to my family were xomfortable. There was a balcony that was attached to the room and that was nice. There was no real view to speak of.The only real complaint that I have about the room is that the curtain steing was broken and so I was unable to raise the curtain, I had to fix iy so that the light could come into the room, but not the way it was intended. The curtain had not been raised as a long time probably because the string was broken because a dust storm hit me when I tried to raise the curtain.

Reviews.Title: “NIce decor and good breakfast..”
Reviews.Author: mammothsales24
Reviews.Content: The Embassy is in a great location because its near casino and the river walk.. Also, close to the WWII Museum.. The hotel over all is pretty dirty or worn. The hotel has great colors and decor throughout the building and foyer. As typical the breakfast is good at Embassy along with free drinks at happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast is the only good quality”
Reviews.Author: SWC2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the location and because breakfast was included. We have had great experiences with Embassy Suites in the past. This one doesn't measure up. The carpeting in our room was filthy. The sofabed was dirty and way past it's prime. We called for extra towels (4 towels for 6 people in our suite even though we had already requested extra towels prior to check in). 2 hours later still no towels. It took 3 calls to get them and by that time I was irate. With small children you can't put off bedtime waiting on housekeeping. The room had 2 full size beds, not queen beds. We paid for internet access and then found out you have to pay for each computer hooked to it, not one fee for the room. I've never had this problem in other hotels. With 4 kids with internet devices that was unacceptable. The breakfast was really great. Good variety. The cocktails and snacks in the evenings would have been nice, but the lines were very long. My advise is to stay elsewhere. I would have given it one star, but the breakfast was a good feature.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: sascoach2003
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Convienient to the Riverwalk, World War II Museum, Aquarium of the Americas, Insectarium, plenty of eateries, and shopping. The cocktail hour was great, free drinks!, and the breakfast buffet was very satisfying and a great way to start off the day. The rooms, all suites, were perfect for 2 adults and 2 kids. They could watch their tv, and we could watch ours, and have a buffer zone between us. The rooms were large, odor-free, bedding just right, and a balcony to look out over the city on. Service was great, especially the valets, and front-desk personnel very helpful. There's a store, with up-charged items should you forget something, and the on-site restaurant was pretty good and not overly pricey, with great New Orleans cusine.

Reviews.Title: “YOLO in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel T
Reviews.Content: Two things attracted my group of friends to this hotel: Free breakfast and free alcohol! Unfortunately, due to staying out until 5am every morning during our trip, we were unable to partake in the made to order omelettes and juice bar. However, kudos to ES for even offering. The other amenity that ultimately led to our hotel decision-making was the Manager's Reception. Unless you're staying in an all-inclusive resort, don't plan on getting free booze at your hotel. BUT the ES is the exception to the rule and if you're looking for a cheap way to start the night off before hitting up Bourbon St, take advantage of this added benefit. The alcohol menu included Miller Light, Coors Light, well drinks and a few bartender specials that they were very secretive to disclose...but very tasty. I'd suggest sticking to the beer. They also provided free chips/salsa and trail mix to keep the gullet full. Now, I must say the rooms were average. Ours included two queen beds and a fold out couch which was much more comfortable sleeping on as an actual couch than the fold out. My friend said he felt the coils in his back each time he moved, which as you can imagine, was super uncomfortable. This came after a 15 hour drinking binge so I can only imagine how a child, or sober person would feel. Our patio didnt have a great view but it was nice to be able to wake up and have a smoke outside, if that's your sort of thing. I did like the layout of the room, with the living area being separate from the beds. We were able to comfortably fit four guys for three days. The bathroom and shower were mostly clean and if you could get used to the NOLA bugs sneaking into the room, it wasnt too bad. Again, the main reason we chose this hotel was because of the free booze and breakfast! The location was actually perfect for us. We chose not to stay in the French Quarter because of price but I think this was a good choice considering almost everything was within walking distance, if walking 10-15 minutes is ok with you. The open drinking laws gave us something to do while making our treks around town! The Riverwalk was basically across the street, Canal and Bourbon are close and Harrah's Casino was nearby. We spent alot of time there, and lost, but had a good time regardless. I would suggest cabbing to the French Market or SuperDome, though. There was also a really good pizza joint down the street called "Pie", which was a pleasant surprise when stumbling back to the hotel. They're open really late and cheap eats! The staff was nice and had some good food/restaurant recommendations. Just ask anyone there for help and they'll kindly assist. Check in/out was a quick process and no problems in this category. Overall, I'd consider this a "Very Good" place to stay. We found a good deal on Priceline about a month before our trip. If this is your first time to New Orleans, as it was mine, you will be pleasantly surprised. It's not really my idea of a "family" trip but if you're going to party and hang out with friends, you'll get your fair share in this town! Think of Vegas without the overpriced drinks, cover charges and douchy nightclubs. Instead, you'll find 3 for 1 drinks, hand grenades, beads and a party on every corner. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and confortable”
Reviews.Author: Santiago M
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this Loft Hotel, very well located, close to the harbour and Canal Street. The bed was very confortable. Very nice experience and highly recommended for families and couples. The price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotels - great service!”
Reviews.Author: SteRos
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 people in a 1 bedroom suite in august 2012. The rooms are not in a good condition, but for OK for sleeping. A "tiny" swimming pool only suitable for children. Plus for great breakfast an daily Managers Reception - 2 hours with free drinks at the bar! Also plus for great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast was amazing....”
Reviews.Author: missmeka
Reviews.Content: Front desk customer service was not the best. Also parking is only valet but you can park on the street for $1 an hour from 8am till 6 pm and after 6 it is free, but they won't tell you that. Very clean and quiet, pool is small but very cozy. Breakfast was amazing and breakfast staff was very polite and food was great.. Location was good, in walking distance of the riverwalk, bourbon street, french quarters, and convention center..

Reviews.Title: “Never Again--Robbed at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BurnedB1994
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for EMF 2012. It was definitely not what we expected from an Embassy Suites. Rooms in terrible condition, 2 hours for breakfast. The worst thing was being robbed. We left our hotel for a couple of hours only to return to a clean room, but our IPads, money, MEDICINE, jewelry, GONE!!! Hotel staff was too accommodating, but overall, we were told by letter that they were not responsible since we did not utilize a safe. We will be seeking legal action!

Reviews.Title: “We have to stay in the old building.”
Reviews.Author: Khl001
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the service an quality I usually get from an Embassy suite hotel but this one I was extremely disappointed. When we got to our room it was one king instead of 2 queen. Then they said they had to put us in the second building which was thru the parking garage across the street. Then rooms were smaller and the ammenities not the same as main building. Before you book this hotel make sure you do your homework and they put you in the new main building that they advertise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: bald347
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the week. The hotel is very nice inside. I got the double queen suite and 4 adults and two children slept without any problems. The room was clean and I don't have any complaints. The included breakfast was very good. You can have them make you a real egg breakfast or eat off of the buffet which has the liquid poured eggs. There is also plenty of room in the dining area. The pool is very very small and kind of dirty but I didn't go to New Orleans to swim in a pool so that didnt matter to me. The total cost for one night stay was $245.00. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Different but a Swell Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mathew M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me as I was a volunteer at a large church youth gathering. I've always enjoyed the amenities of Embassy Suites and was looking forward to staying at one. Check-in was speedy aside from the long line of other volunteers trying to do the same. My room was on the 13th floor all the way at the end of the hall. At least, I thought it would be a hall. I ended up having to go outdoors into an exterior corridor, much safer than a motel as it was on the 13th floor but still, back out into the soup of humidity (and pouring rain later in the week). The suite was nice. The building itself seems to be older evidenced by some cracks here in there on walls and ceilings. The refrigerator was turned a bit too cold as some of my leftovers from breakfast froze during the day. The thermostat was set at 60 when I walked in... much too cold. I turned it up to 70 and enjoyed a much more comfortable stay. The balcony is not much of a balcony as it is a place to just step outside and view the highway, about a half mile away. All in all, the room met my expectations. Because of my volunteer work I did not have the opportunity to partake in the daily happy hour, but I did enjoy a perfect free breakfast each morning. This hotel had one of the best breakfast spreads I have ever seen. There were varieties in cereals, yogurts, fruits, breads and pastries. Plenty of juices, milk and soda (if that is what you drink at breakfast). They rotate three main hot dishes (pancakes, french toast, and buscuits/gravy). I always made my way to the omelet station. Chef Robert was very personable each day and enjoyed his work. He even knew my order as the week went on, a superb job. I visited the business center a few times to check-in at home. The internet was slow and it seemed that whenever there was more than one person in the room, the connection would freeze. Oh well, I didn't need to spend time online, but it was nice to do every once in awhile. Business travelers should be warned, however. Check-out was as easy as the check-in and I was on my way to the airport at the end of the week. An avid cruiser myself, this would be a great hotel for those heading to the cruise port. It is a walkable distance if you choose to walk and is nearby the Riverwalk mall where you can do some shopping and find some local food as well as good views of the Mississippi River.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to enjoy NOLA, don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Tangledteacher1
Reviews.Content: This is probably the worst hotel I've stayed at in a long time. It is very old, not in a quaint NOLA way, but in a shoddy run down way (paint chipping faucets coming loose). The hallways smell weird, the balcony views are terrible, unless you enjoy roof tops and/or the highway. Our coffee maker didn't work, neither did the blow dryer. The staff is amazingly rude!! Bottom line, there's too many choices in NOLA to make the same mistake we did.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotels for Essence Festival 2012”
Reviews.Author: SBenard00
Reviews.Content: This ES was very different than all the rest. No atrium as rooms were to outside as it seems as this was a Roadway Inn before and it has the same appearance. Rooms were terrible as we were up on floor 13 and went outside to go to the room. This was not acceptable. Got a room inside but not that much better. Stayed in two separte rooms while there and both had that not clean look and feel to it. This is why we always get extra sheet to sleep on and this time it was very necessary. Broken fixtures and mold looking dirt on and near vent. Toilet paper on sink because anchor for holder broken. Refrig freezer door bot there and refrig hot. Terrible stay especially charging $200+ a night for rooms but they were all sold out for the festival. Women taking off heels as NO sidewalks were terrible. Sink hole right outside EM on Julia st. Breakfast crowded. Business Center had no pens.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Maggipie
Reviews.Content: My family came with me for a conference in April. The kids were excited to visit NOLA, the setting for one of the Scooby Doo movies. Overall, we were happy with our stay; there were a few minor issues that were a little annoying, but nothing big that would prevent us from staying here again. We arrived really late, and were put into the lofts, too tired and sleepy to look out the window until the next morning, when we had a fantastic view of a brick wall a foot away. We were on the fourth floor; one floor above and we wouldn't feel like we were in prison. We solved this by not looking out the window much. We liked that there is a breakfast available at the lofts too (though no cooked to order omelettes) so you do not need to walk over to the main building. The staff at the main front desk and the staff manning the front desk in the lofts were all very friendly and helpful. We liked that Riverwalk Marketplace was a very short 2-3 blocks away, which had lots of local merchants including a branch of Cafe du Monde to get your beignets without the crazy wait of the main branch. From RIverwalk you can take the convenient streetcar into or back from the French quarter if you have kids that complain when they start walking too far.

Reviews.Title: “Electronics Stolen”
Reviews.Author: Raquel S
Reviews.Content: We booked a multi family suite at the Embassy Suites in New Orleans from 2/10/12-2/12/12. On 2/11/12, we left the hotel to attend an event across town. We left the hotel at 4:13pm, according to the door key reader ran after our goods were stolen from our room. We were gone for 2-3 hours. While we were gone, someone used a guest key, made by an employee at the hotel, to enter our room and steal 2 e-readers, a mac book, a hp laptop, a digital camera, and jewelry. The jewelry was my motherâ€™s and included her grandmotherâ€™s engagement ring! Irreplaceable items, to say the least. We immediately reported this to the staff who appeared uncaring and basically dismissed us. We contacted the police and I also contacted the Hilton Corporate office. The New Orleans P.D. was honest and understanding. They followed up with us the next day. At this same hotel on this same day, another multifamily room that was staying a few floors up, had electronics stolen from their room also. Both rooms were located close to stairways. We were told that this type of thing rarely happens before we talked to the other family that had items stolen. We by chance found this other family in passing. When our items were stolen, the manager at the hotel that night was very unkind and uncaring. He dismissed us and refused, at first, to contact anyone higher than him in management. We suggested the police be called so that we could report the stolen goods. This was not recommended by the hotel security or administration but we insisted and eventually contacted them ourselves. Hotel security did not follow proper procedure when our items were reported stolen. We found out the next day that they were supposed to run a key reader to determine the time of entries into our rooms immediately. This was not completed until the next day! When this was ran by the head of security, it documented that there were 2 entries into our room during times we were across town and had receipts to prove our whereabouts. Although we had met with the General Manager and Security Director the next morning with the other family and had some hope that action would be taken, it appears the Embassy Suites Company and Hilton let this matter fall between the cracks and do not want to take any responsibility. We received a letter a month later stating that they were not claiming fault in the matter because we did not utilize the safe or leave our valuables with hotel staff. When I emailed them back and explained that there was not a safe and I would not feel safe leaving the items with the front desk clerk that gave a complete stranger a key to our room, the security team that allowed our room to be broken into, or the office manager who was uncaring and blaming. The response we received was that Hilton was further looking into the manner. It is now 5 months later and Hiltonâ€™s Embassy Suites has not claimed any responsibility in this manner. It is with this in mind that I recommend you do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rashad1030
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, nice room and breakfast was great. The staff was very friendly, helpful, spoke with a smile and very attentative the guest! I would stay again!!!!! Parking was to much, $30 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a busy weekend. This hotel is suffering! Rooms were not adequately cleaned and musty. Decor is worn. Bathrooms are tiny. The buffet breakfast was overwhelmed with people. Overall, I would not stay here unless forced. Paid about $285 for a 2 bedroom. Parking is $30/day. About a 15 minute walk to the Superdome or French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: Peachymom2
Reviews.Content: This is not like the Embassy Suites we've stayed in before. This one is old with poor lighting and outdated furnishings & decor. I could've kicked myself when I checked in. I made my reservation for Blackboard World in January & passed up many other hotel choices! They had to change my rooms 3x before I found one suitable. The first one was outside (motel-like) & the second was not clean. The third one was just right. The female hotel clerk was super nice & patient in helping to get me settled (7/8). The male clerk was arrogant with a smart mouth. Ask him a question & he would answer followed by a sarcastic comment. Everyone else was extremely nice! The breakfast & manager's reception were nice. The staff was extremely attentive. However, I would never stay here again because it needs updating badly. The lighting is awful in the rooms. And my room was small for a suite. The location was good.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay with great service”
Reviews.Author: TXNnPA
Reviews.Content: I was recently here for a large music festival and despite the hotel being at ocupancy the staff was amazing. Houskeeping remembered to bring extra towels, conceirge found reservations at good recommendations at the last minute and the bellman were quick to find transportation. The process ran so smooth, you'd never have known the hotel was at occupancy. The breakfast was good and the location allows you to be off Bourbon but within walking distance (about 6 blocks) and only 2 blocks to the Convention. As the cab situation proved you can even walk to the Superdome in comfortable shoes. The only downside, the halls could undergo a good steam cleaning but the rooms were very clean. I fit 6 females in this room comfortably.

Reviews.Title: “EMF 2012”
Reviews.Author: SHARMANJ2924
Reviews.Content: Ok stay, but I would have rather moved to the lofts. Since this was my first time there we had no ideal what to expect with the amount of people at the festival. But the the hotel should have been prepared!!! checked in 4 hours after check in time and our group was split up. Loft group much better accomondations. Maid service sucked!!! Everyday we had to call down stairs for towels. My last complaint with them is that they could have ran a shuttle to the superdome for the shows. I have never stayed in a hotel that did not run a shuttle for the main events. Even if they would have charged a small fare everyone would have paid it. Breakfest & cocktails excellent...

Reviews.Title: “Easy choice in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Pamela-and-Greg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed an many Embassy Suites, this one was about normal. The location in New Orleans is good, 3 blocks from the Convention Center, Riverwalk and Canal Street. It is a bit of a walk to Bourbon Street and a long walk to Cafe Du monde. There are two arrival areas, on on Julia Street and one around the corner on Peters St. If you want to valet or self park use the entrance on Peters St. If you arrive by cab they will drop you off at the Julia St. entrance. We arrived by car and parked at the Julia St. entrance, no one came out to greet us. We went inside and finally got acknowledged and then someone helped us, Broderick is his name, a good guy who did a good job. The check in was fine however the young lady who helped us is a trainee. We asked her if they had laundry facilities at the hotel, she told us no and that we would need to send our stuff out. When we inquired later about dropping off our laundry the gentleman who we talked to told us about the guest laundry on the 7th floor, it saved us a fortune, it was free except for the soap. The rooms were small for embassy suites. The hall way between the sitting area and bedroom was quite small as was the bathroom, one of the few that have only one sink. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The Managers reception was normal with the exception that the lines where very long and the serving area was small. Of course the snacks were standard fare now a days, chips and salsa, pretzels. Used to be that you would get vegetables and chips and some other nice items other than the above. The pool area was very small, right at street level so you could here all of the cars going by. The Embassy Suites Convention Center is a good hotel, service was good with the exceptions I have already stated. The one problem we had a check out was we needed help with our bags, we called and were told they would be right up. It took 2 phone calls and 20 minutes to get help. Staffing, funny, I have said that in a number of my reviews, was the issue. They did have 3 people on duty but only one of them were making bag runs. The hotel was very full and you would think they would staff to handle the crowd, Nope!! This is not just a problem with this property but it did affect us. The young man who helped us was not a very happy young man at first. Once we started talking to him he cheered up. He was very happy when we told him that we needed a cab. He had left his whistle at home and was not happy about yelling. However, my wife can whistle, he was very impressed with this and we actually got a smile out of him. I wish I could remember his name but we want to thank him for his help.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...Not bad at all!!”
Reviews.Author: Postalsaint
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews here, I was a little reluctant to book. This was the hotel my family picked for a family reunion so I went with it and overall I am glad I did. It was a little pricey, but so are all of the downtown hotels in most major cities. It is a little farther away from the French Quarter than most of the other hotels, but still within walking distance. The Riverwalk shopping mall was 3 blocks down. I did have 2 VERY minor issues with my room, both were taken care promptly. (Batteries for remote, broken ironing board.) I would pay the $30.00 for parking as I am not sure about the lack of security parking along the street. Breakfast for a family of 5 was included in the price we paid. Overall, if I wanted a hotel in Downtown NO I would book this hotel again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was closer to the quarter”
Reviews.Author: murphy50_11
Reviews.Content: Overall a decent property. The breakfast is good and the hotel is clean, but slightly weathered. The staff was accomodating. It's a bit of a walk to the quarter, or you can cab it for about $6. Always good to know for your ride home. Mulate's a good family restaurant is just a block away towars the river. Have eaten there a few times, fabulous gumbo and the BBQ shrimp Po-boy a winner as well. The flat panel tv's had horrible reception, could barely watch anything on the one in the bedroom. But hey, folks don't go to the big easy to watch tv..just annoying. Overall a fair value for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Eat dinner early!”
Reviews.Author: FlamingoAZ
Reviews.Content: Great location if you're cruising out of New Orleans. It is walking distance to the port. Spacious suites, lots of tables at breakfast, great happy hour (watch out for that hurricane punch!), pool, business center, and gym. Only problem is that there are NO family friendly restaurants within walking distance. The Riverwalk has a great food court right across the way but they close at 7 pm!

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnTheGo24
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, we were a little hesitant about what we might encounter upon our arrival in the Big Easy. But . . . We found this hotel to be really good. The staff was EXCELLENT - from the moment we pulled up in front of the hotel until the moment we pulled away. The lobby was clean and open - like Embassy Suites are usually. Our room was in great shape. Clean. Quiet. Comfortable. We even had a small balcony overlooking Julia St. Breakfast was good and plentiful each morning, and again the staff was so friendly! The building was not perfect. Sure it has seen its share of conventions and Mardi Gras and football games I am sure. This is New Orleans for heaven's sake! We never felt uncomfortable. And would certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a HILTON”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel927
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week there from 5/26 to 6/3/12. Rooms we not very clean. Maid service was a hit and miss. Rooms were need of repairs. There was a hole at the bottom for my front door. On my Balcony there was a drinking glass with butts in it. Called front desk to remove, it was still their when we left. It took 17hrs for TV to be fixed. My phone went dead on the last day. Lamp was broken,never fixed. The last two days there were ants in my Bedroom,which I had to kill because no else did. Pool was very small. Too many unsupervised children . Breakfast! Cooks were not very organized. Food was not made to your order but to there order. Managers reception was a JOKE. There would be 70 to 80 people on line for a drink and 1 bartender. Only went once. The staff was Good answered all question well. I'm a HH Hilton Member and I've been with the company for over 15 yrs. and I must say this was the worst Hotel I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Dark”
Reviews.Author: Sumo6773
Reviews.Content: Rooms were dusty, hallways were very musty and dark. Breakfast was great. Just about anything you want for breakfast is available. Hot and made to order. Ask for free internet upgrade, they will give it to you considering you have to pay $30 daily for parking. Location is great. Few blocks from everything or take the trolley which is 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mombeege123
Reviews.Content: The most important thing is that our rooms were clean and we felt safe. Housekeeping came every day and brought fresh towels and shampoos. I had read that there was a problem with hot water, well not on our floor (12). The staff was always friendly and ready to help. The pool was small and always cold, but at least they had one. Room service was quick and love that you have a frig and microwave for the midnight snack. The breakfast hours could be extended a little. Ending at 9:30 when they are an hour ahead of my reg, time, I had to sometimes rush to make it.Having valet parking was a bit of a pain cuz you already have to pay so much to park per day and then to tip was a bit much. But we felt very safe going to and from our car at any time of day.Yes it is a little dated, but nothing to get all uptight about like some of the reviewers reported.There are many things to do in the day that are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired....”
Reviews.Author: takemeaway1127
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs an update, seems a bit rundown. Breakfast omelet staff was fun and friendly and bell/conciege team also helpful. Rooms were worn and not too comfortable bed. I've stayed in several Embassy's but this was not the greatest!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: lexus112
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy and I was a little scared of what type of room we will get based on some of the reviews. We'll the picture of the hotel they show online is not the way the hotel looks for one. The lobby area is very nice and updated for sure. Now the outside is very colorful pink and yellow like everything else in New Orleans. The staff was very nice and helpful. This definetly is a older Embassy but my room was updated and nice and clean. Our friends stayed in the lofts this a extention to the main hotel about 1 block away, they really liked the lofts but there are not king size beds in this part of the hotel. The only thing that is weird is with the main hotel once you are in the hotel they have some rooms that you have to go outside to get to your room so it is not like a typical Embassy. The location to me was not all that great from where we wanted to hang out at, it is very close to Riverpark Mall but theres not much to do there but walk around and see stuff. And close to Harrahs Casino. The next time I will stay somewhere closer to the main attractions, we saw a lot of hotel on Canal that is closer to some of the attractions we went to. Make sure you wear sneakers or comfortable shoes no heels ladies! Parking was $30 a night which I did not like because the rate was $179 so we should be parking for free really. But parking at the garage verses at some of the other places would have been about the same so it was convienent to park at the hotel. Very quiet area away from the craziness, the only problem I had was to toilet kept making a noise but I didn't complain I just shut the door.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and stinky, service is so so, stay in the Lofts annex or go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Grizzlies901
Reviews.Content: This Is not like any other Embassy Suites I have ever seen. I travel frequently for business and pleasure, and I know things happen sometimes, and don't expect total perfection, nor am I one of those people who minds a little funk - when you're staying in a funky place. But you expect a certain standard with a corporate chain, and you sure don't get it here. This place is in need of a total overhaul. The layout of the halls In the main building is byzantine. Many of the rooms are 50 yards from the elevator - I am not kidding. The carpeting is black from use. We asked to move rooms after checking in - due to being next to two rooms of loud, cursing party animals. Two of the three offered rooms smelled like they had really major mold issues. Finally, an hour later, we (there were 4 of us) ended up crammed into a much smaller room at The Lofts, a newer and much nicer annex in another building a block from the hotel. The manager was very nice and accommodating, as was the lady serving breakfast. The room was very nice, but really not suitable for 4 people. Ricky the bellman was wonderfully sweet and helpful. Other than that, the service was slow and indifferent. Requests to call a cab were met with just go out in the street and get one yourself, and upon pulling up to the hotel and being asked if we were checking in and valet parking, we were told to take the car to the garage ourselves. All in all, no question - a NOLA hotel fail.

Reviews.Title: “About the worst I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: seaski42
Reviews.Content: We are attending an event in New Orleans and embassy suites is the official hotel. This is a great hotel for a gathering...people can get together for breakfast and happy hour in a pleasant central location. BUT the rooms are awful!!! They are not only dated but dirty. I have read previous reviews saying that the dirt should be overlooked because New Orleans is so old...no excuse !!! I stayed in a hundred year old castle last week that was spotless. I don't even want to set on this hotel's couch because it is so nasty! An old hotel can still have clean rugs, walls, and couches. It is 3:30 in the afternoon and our room has still not been cleaned. The entire facility needs to be gutted and remodeled. Embassy Suites has always been a positive experience for me so I am really disappointed in this one. We are paying over two hundred dollars per night (plus the $30 a day for car parking) for a hotel that is not even as nice as the local Motel 6!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: acwtsn2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convenient location for the Riverwalk, French Quarter, and Harrah's. Just a short walk away there are many shops and restaurants. There is a bus located at the Riverwalk that will take you, for $1.25, to various places in the area. The cost of a taxi from the hotel to Bourbon Street was $8. The hotel itself could use a fresh coat of paint, etc., but all in all it is clean. We were on the 16th floor and had good view of the river and the cruise ships coming in. All of the staff did a great job but, Rick, from the front area, did a particularly good job to make sure our stay was pleasant. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel need work”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkPamela
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well located and most of the front desk staff are lovely, but that is about where it ends. the property is very dated, and the decor is dark. the outside of the building is filthy, and the dark colors inside make it a bit depressing. some of the rooms require long walks and staircases between where buildings have been joined. those rooms have low ceilings and are long and low and have lift windows which make them feel like bunkers. The food is very average and in four days, i am unable to get a bottle of water out of a ending machine. room services delivers without enough plates and silverware and no water on the tray. i am so sorry this was out choice for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “for us the perfect hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ulcologne
Reviews.Content: we spent there 3 nights in the building aside with the lofts, a former sugar refinery fabrik. The suite was big, perfectly equipped and in excellent condition and with the style and flair of the fabric. Free internet, free drinks in the happy hour and an excellent breakfast made its to us for a excellent value for money. Parking is extra cost and in the high time there is some queuing and waiting for the food/ drinks.Pool is quite small. The location is still ok, 10-15Min walking distance to Burbon Street and most attractions of the city. My daughter forgot her wallet in the room. This has been found, I had an excellent contact to the lady in the lost and found and she has returned it to us immediately. Thanks a lot for the honest cleaning people and the good service in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time and Stay for French Qtr. Festival”
Reviews.Author: NOLAFan_12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times before and always enjoy myself. The Front Desk staff, Breakfast cooks and servers, & the Great bartenders always greet you with a smile. I stayed here when It was very busy with the French Quarter Festival going on in April, a must do if you have never been. A short walk to the river front street car to take you to French Quarter or just put your walking shoes on and enjoy the sites, great food and everything that makes New Orleans a great destination. I have already booked this hotel for next year and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: TBROBINSON
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for the CTIA convention this year. When I travel domestically I try to stay in Hilton or Embassy Suite properties as they tend to be convenient for meetings. Check In: We arrived mid day, before check in time. We were attended to quickly, and I suppose since I am the person with higher priority I was given a room and the other two in my party had to wait. That is too be expected in convention time, and they were polite and organized about it. What I did not like was that one of my people was put in a different type of room, a non suite (which I did not know Embassy Suites had) and the rate was the same. The clerk knew this was a bad deal and could not look us in the eyes, mumbled she was sorry and dismissed us. When i got to my room I found either it was a smoking room or someone smoked there, and since the hotel was full, that was that. I have significant alergies to smoke so that is an issue, I had made our reservations 5 months ahead of time just to make sure that we got non-smoking rooms. Dining Room: We did have a few meals in the restaurant. Food was good, and the service very polite, but painfully slow. Manager's Cocktail party. A little above average in terms of the snacks etc. It is a large area for the event so there is plenty of comfortable seating. Definately a high point :-) Breakfast The buffet line was organized and moved well. Typical Embassy Suites breakfast, which is a selling point for the restaurant. Gym This is a little gem in the hotel with enough room and machines to accomodate the crowd. Very well done and maintained, another high point. Overall property condition The property, being very close to the convention center (it is two blocks away), gets alot of hard use I am sure, and it shows. It is a well worn property, generally clean. My room had a newer flat screen TV in both room, the carpet, and furnishings were tired. And the smoke smell (see previous comment). Staff I was impressed with the staff here in general. They were friendly to a fault, and smiling. Someone has trained them up on customer service, little things like taking you to where you were asking about, instead of pointing and saying "its over there" is pretty rare these days. Kudos to the GM or person in charge of training. Overall the staff, the manager's reception, and breakfast slightly overweigh the condition of the place, so we will most likely return. Would be nice to see this property get a facelift though. There are alot of nice hotels close....

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in room 225!”
Reviews.Author: Laura L
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel! Our room on the 2nd floor had one tiny window and was the last room on the hallway. It made the room like a dungeon! Lamp in the living room had no bulb and outlet in the main bedroom did not work. I should have requested a room change. Overall staff was very friendly except for the young lady I encountered at checkout. I was charged for parking for one night when we didn't have a car. She wouldn't take my word for it and had to check with two different people in the garage. When I assured her we knew nobody by the name of Ann she took it off the bill! Final insult was when she handed me my final bill and walked away to help another guest. No I'm sorry for your trouble, no have a nice day, just rudely thrust the bill in my hand! This will be my last stay at the Embassy Suites Chain!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at in a very long time.”
Reviews.Author: vfischer
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel because first of all it does cooked to order complimentary breakfast delicious! Then it has complimentary cocktails and snacks every evening from 5:30 to 7:30 for the Managers reception! Very friendly and helpful staff, and beautiful rooms that are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Will Probably Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: leavingonajetplane40
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites New Orleans for 3 nights in April. We were there for business and the hotel is fairly close to the convention center but not within easy walking distance. The front desk and concierge were very nice and were able to accomodate us with an available room when we arrived at 10:00 am. The room was spacious but the bathroom was very small. The bed was comfortable. The food (both in the restaurant and via room service) was quite good. The 'gift shop' was small but covered the necessities. My only real complaint was that the hotel looks tired. The hall carpeting is threadbare and or stained in many places. The room and hallway had a very musty smell and needed cosmetic updating. We visited the Hilton Riverside, Loews and Roosevelt for meetings and they all seemed in better shape. Of course we didn't see the rooms...only the common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Small problems added up.”
Reviews.Author: dolby05
Reviews.Content: While the Embassy Suites is well-located for convention-goers (near the Convention Center, Riverwalk, and several excellent restaurants), there were enough little inconveniences to make us unlikely to stay there again. Although we'd booked well in advance, we arrived to find them "out of" rooms with a queen or king bed. We also found that we were not in the main building, but in the Lofts next door, which meant walking back the 1/2 block for either the Manager's cocktail hour or the better complementary breakfast (no omelet bar in the Lofts...). Not a problem in beautiful weather, but not attractive in the rain. The Lofts suite was large, high-ceilinged and generally comfortable, but ill-lit, particularly in the bathroom, where it was difficult to see well enough to apply make-up in the evening. The double beds were comfortable, and linen service was good. The staff were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else next time...”
Reviews.Author: SRICHESON
Reviews.Content: I wanted to give a good review for this property because a the staff was great. They seem to be working to update some areas, and some are still pretty worn. The hot tub was not working nor the heater for the pool. I would not have stayed here if they would have told me this at check in, as I had two high energy small kids that was ready to swim. Housekeeping could do a better job in the rooms as well. The breakfest was great! The hotel resturant was great as well. Parking is $30 per night but seems typical for New Orleans. Very close to cruise port and river walk market place. It's a long walk to the French Quarters. The free drinks in the evening are nice, but this is not your Embassy Suites...

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are somewhat dated.”
Reviews.Author: JoeB70
Reviews.Content: The rooms are somewhat dated, but then so is everything in New Orleans. The breakfast is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Would try another place next time in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: travelpleasures
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a 1bedroom with balcony. Room had a musty type smell that wouldn't go away during the stay (we opened windows and burned incense as attempts). Very thin walls. no provacy in the balcony. Couldn't get a standard size pillow for the bed, only throw-size (they said they were out). Shower & pipes were run-down, toilet seat had a stain. Place needs some update/work. Sheets weren't cleaned upon staining and housekeeping staff was very persistent to the point of disturbing. Concierge VERY helpful and friendly. I think they were my first true experience of 'southern hospitality.' Free breakfast was tasty, but an absolute zoo-on the last morning we opted to pay somewhere else rather than deal with that again. Location was decent-5 min walk to riverfront & streetcar (which is very convenient during the day, nightime it barely runs), 15min fast walk to start of bourbon st. This was my first time in NO; next time I go, i will get a spot closer to french quarter, as that is really the only place of interest to be, and there has to be better-kept hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: ldavey_10
Reviews.Content: The room was big and roomy, a bit of a musty smell. THe staff were very acomodating with our oversize car, box lunches for our habitat building days and finding a family friendly restaurant. The pool area is very small and not situated for sunbathing. The breakfast area was huge and bright with decent food. A bit farther walking distance than advertised to interest areas.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good on paper...”
Reviews.Author: Jaci C
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites was walking distance (10-15min) from Bourbon street, had a free hot breakfast every morning annnd a free happy hour from 530-730. Sounds great, right?! When we got there and checked in, we heard there was a pool... things were sounding even better than we anticipated! Then came the reality: cockroaches. We found a huge (dead) cockroach upon arrival on the rug and the one of our group found a sack of cockroach eggs IN HER COFFEE CUP at breakfast, which she had already had a few sips out of! GROSS! The hotel offered her free dinner, but of course after this little mishap, eating at the hotel restaurant was never going to happen again. We also suspected that one of the suites has bed bugs... suspicious bite marks and small blood stains on the sheets were enough proof for us to take all of our things to the laundry mat upon arrival home. It was unfortunate that the hotel made us all queasy by the end of the trip -- the hallways had a weird stench and the cleaning people neglected to come to our room 2 of the 4 days we were there-- because besides that, the trip was great and the location was good! Sorry Embassy Suites. Maybe you should cut down on your happy hour and upgrade your pest control?

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Embassy Suites before (and I am particularly fond of the one in D.C.) but was a bit disappointed with this one. We came back to the room 2 days in a row to find that it had not been cleaned (we learned that housekeeping quits at 4pm, whether or not they get to all the rooms). After we called on the second day to get it cleaned, they did quickly get to it. Other major complaint was that on all 6 of the floors I visited the hallways stank...seriously. Sometimes of urine, sometimes chlorine. Thank goodness the room smelled fine! The hotel is also in a good, quiet location within easy walking distance to the French Quarter and the streetcars to the Garden District.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suite stay the night before the cruise”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Embassy Suite was very pleasant. Our room on the 5th floor was nice size. It was my wife and I, our grand daughter and son. There was plenty of room. Two queen beds in one room, and a pull out sofa in the other room. The room was clean and accommodating. We made arrangements to park my sons car at the hotel. My truck was oversized, so the parking attendent made arrangements to park my truck in the overflow parking lot about a block away. The parking attendents were very professonal and helpful. The staff at the hotel were very helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Conference in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: GinaUys
Reviews.Content: 3 of us went to New Orleans for a conference at the Convention Center. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from the Convention Center. Staff is very friendly and professional. A hot breakfast is included. There is a free Happy Hour from 5:30 - 7:30pm. You can get the street car (tram) from River Walk or from Julia Road to the French Quarter or the Garden district or wherever. Both stops are within walking distance from the hotel. There was a small balcony off the bedroom. The front door faced the inner courtyard of the hotel which was very nicely decorated. Cons: The sleeper couch in the room was not very comfortable. Sunday night it was extremely noisy outside the hotel. Sounded like cars racing around. They need to put an extra mirror in the room out of the bathroom so that someone can be showering and someone else could be doing their makeup. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Final Four”
Reviews.Author: JimWPPA
Reviews.Content: Reserved an Executive Suite. Got an executive suite. Arrived 1pm, room wouldn't be ready till 3pm. no biggie. Closet in room is broken, carpet is worn, has a bit of a funky odor, no free wifi, elevator situation is tenuous (long waits often). When we arrived there was no Bell Staff. Limo driver put our stuff on the curb and i had to carry all my elderly fathers luggage and mine up the stairs (golf clubs and a weeks worth of stuff). Non Bell Staff just stood around and watched. Bed is confortabble, not great - but very good, breakfast is nice, happy hour is a nice touch. Consierge was not a help, useless actually. No one had any answers regarding transit schedules, special events or even helpful advice about the city for the Final Four. Maybe I am just used to staying at a better class of property, this one is old, the couch was uncomfortable, the HVAC system is vey dated, although it did push out a great deal of cold air - you just couldn't control it very well, it was basically on/off. Room was large and certainly met our needs, I would have liked it to be better, but it was a last minute trip. Just lucky to get a room many other guests actually got the hotel through 3rd party vendors and paid $750-1,000 a night. I paid $600 a night, pricey for sure. They do know how to throw a party in New Orleans and to gouge you for the priviledge. There is the tiniest pool I have ever seen at a hotel and a even smaller jacuzzi. Both were unavailable due to 25 kids running around. If you can, if it is available, The Ritz Carlton, The JW Marriott and even the Sheraton are much nicer hotels in the city. The Ritz is of course pricier, however there are many other nicer hotels for the price.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lapel555
Reviews.Content: Not sure why there are negative reviews- we recently stayed 5 nights in an executive suite. The space was amazing, our room was clean albeit a little dated. The check in staff was friendly, the bellmen and staff at breakfast were even friendlier. Cooked to order breakfast was great. The happy hour snacks were simply nachos, salsa and pretzel mix. Just okay, but free none the less. The benefits of the hotel outweigh the dated look. Free wi-fi is not available anywhere in the hotel other than the 3 desktops in the business center. Hint: when I complained to the front desk, they gave me a promo code intended for special Hilton members which gave me free 24 hour access. Good convention center location, easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “"Is this really Emabssy Suites"”
Reviews.Author: Ngasca
Reviews.Content: We choose Emabsssy Suites because this is always our got o hotel chain...always clean, nicely decorated and a safe place. Yeah not at this location!!! Stayed there only 1 day (thank goodness) before hopping on our cruise ship(location to port is fabulous!), when we walked into the hotel the 1st thing we seen was one of the hotles cooks on the phone at the front desk cussing somebody out! Check was easy, got on elevator to 6the floor, had to walk all the way down the hall and then exit out to the exterior corridor to get to our room....not what I expected from Embassy Suites, an exterior room! Not a safe feeling! Opened the door to the room and boy was I surprised, it was about 1 step up from a "hooker hotel"! Dark dreary unkept and outdated looking! Changed to interior room but same grubby look!

Reviews.Title: “World's most unfriendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkelly1959
Reviews.Content: 9 of us traveled in a motor home all night to stay over the St. Patricks day weekend, Reserved 3 rooms for 4 nights WITH A CREDIT CARD,,,assured on the phone the rooms would be waiting so we could crash, clean up and have a free day before our annual convention, "Greg" at the front desk says ..."you were not here by Midnight and we gave your rooms away".....and then added.."Oh yes, we billed your card for the rooms last night"....would not help us find more rooms....kept repeating in a slow, condensending voice.."you don't understand - we have no rooms".....never have I had to hold back 3 Woman from strangling a Clerk. Marriott put us up......Embassy Suites called 3 hours later...Greg was wrong, we have your rooms. Marriott was clean, nice, packed. Embassy, old, tired, dirty.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed in Hilton”
Reviews.Author: RKHerbert
Reviews.Content: We usually love Embassy Suites as a family vacation spot but this trip was disappointing. The room was not ready at 5pm despite the 3pm check-in. No options were available for parking other than valet and the car was parked blocks away. For our family of 4 (with more than 4 suitcases and the sleeper sofa pulled out), they never left more than 2 towels, even when taking away 5. Breakfast was good as usual. Just wished we had stayed at the Homewood Suites instead, it looks much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: K8Mac1
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at valet parking (only parking available at hotel) was $33/day. That's the going rate for the area which is ridiculous, but people will pay that price. Bellman are so nice....especially Rickey. Front desk staff and consigiere are mediocre at best. The supervisors at front desk are nice and courteous. I will say, the hotel is quiet, and I think that is because you enter a living room area and then a bedroom, so you don't get the hallway noise. The complimentary breakfast is really good. Go for the omelet bar in the back because all of the food is hot.

Reviews.Title: “"Go to" NOLA hotel”
Reviews.Author: scarlett45
Reviews.Content: I went to undergrad at Loyola University New Orleans, and this was the hotel my family always utilized when they came to visit me. Now that I am back in the Windy City, when I go visit friends I always stay at the Embassy Suites. It's a great hotel for groups. The two rooms with two tvs cannot be beat. On my last trip my BFF (a woman) and our mutual friend (a man) shared a suite without a glitch. Everyone got to watch what they wanted to on tv, and still maintained a bit of privacy (which we all liked). The mini-fridge, coffee maker and microwave are GREAT. We never wanted for snacks, and could heat up our left overs when we got the midnight munchies. When our coffee maker looked like it was on the fritz, it was replaced quickly. Embassy suites is known for their hot, cooked to order complimentary breakfast. Being the gluttonous person I am, I do like to go out for breakfast, but the free breakfast is always used the morning we depart to save on time. However the coffee leaves a LOT to be desired. I think they provide weak coffee on purpose to get you to buy the Starbucks coffee at the gift shop. The service was good, my only complaint is that they ran out of pillows! The valet guys are hard working (yes I know you have to valet, but space in downtown NOLA is at a premium). There is a full gift shop, where you can buy any toiletries you may be lacking, as well as postcards, snacks etc to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The location is great, just a walk to the French Quarter (or a cab ride if your feet hurt) and a hop, skip and a jump to River Walk. I love Hilton Hotels, and if you are traveling to NOLA with friends this is THE place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, better this time”
Reviews.Author: ASSEDO
Reviews.Content: About a year ago, I stayed at the hotel and would have judged it OK, probably would not have made the effort to return had we not been scheduled to attend a convention in the building. This time, the atmosphere/comfort was so much better. I joined friends from Washington State, and we all enjoyed our stay. The rooms are large, the bed was comfortable, and TVâ€™s have been upgraded to flat screen. We had Omelets in the mornings with other nice breakfast foods. At 5:30 the manager had cocktails, and the bartenders offered their suggestions. I enjoyed the entire experience. The hotel is located near the National WW2 museum, which is a must see event for every American. We visited the Civil War museum, and Blaine Kernâ€™s Mardi Gras museum, both are within walking distance. On a rainy day, we took the hotel Conciergesâ€™ advice and took a city tour. A tour bus picked us up at the front door, and the two hour tour was grand. Even though I visit New Orleans on a frequent basis, I learned many details about the city though the tour guide. The hotel is located near the cruise ship terminal. Keep in mind, the building is old, so are most of the buildings in New Orleans. Parking was $30.00 per day. The internet is not free, so take your Mobile Hotspot, or switch off the Wifi and go 3G

Reviews.Title: “was leary after mixed reviews, not now”
Reviews.Author: Roger M
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I wasn`t really sure what to expect so let me base it on my room location because I`m sure that would make a difference with a hotel like this. We stayed in room 504 which overlooks the atrium at the front door of the room and the balcony was over the front entrance on Julia St....great room, easy to get too, spacious, two big tvs and a HUGE washroom......not the cleanest room I have ever been in but it was fine. A little noisy in the morning because the kitchen is in the atrium so you can hear the plates clanging first thing in the morning for the all you can eat-made to order breakfast. But if I was to stay again which I would I would like the same location of room......it was quiet at night. The lady conceirege was the best I have ever had.......I`m sorry I don`t know her name but she alone made it a wonderful stay......the desk staff were okay but the bellhop was great.....free all you can drink managers reception every night was awesome......anything you want to drink for two hours...........location truly is the best as you are just short inexpensive cablecar ride to the french quarter and a two minute walk to the riverwalk mall which is great.....its quite at night and we felt safe............we had no car thank god because 300 bucks a night for parking is something I would not pay for............this place is not a dump in any manner, book with confidence..........oh and no free internet.......outside of that it was good...........and yes I would stay there again and my wife is very picky and clean.........she would stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but some irritations”
Reviews.Author: JMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: first, this is a nice place, well located and clean. My wife and I stayed here for Mardi Gras on Monday, and then Fat Tuesday. We had a suite in the lofts, a building about a half block away from the main facility. The 1st thing I noticed was a broken light socket with a cfl bulb hanging by the wires. Then I tried to turn on the tv in the main room, but it would not work. We tried to call the main desk, but the phone did not work either. When we went out we stopped at the the desk, and they indicated that engineering would be notified. When we returned, the phone was working, but the tv and bulb were not repaired. I went to get some ice, but the ice machine on our floor was not working, and I had to go to another floor. The next day the light and TV were repaired by late afternoon when we returned. When we left on Wednesday morning the ice machine was still not functioning. Positive: clean large rooms,,good location, managers reception, excellent breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Theft”
Reviews.Author: pammeyk
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lofts starting Thurs 2/16/12 started off great.. then on Monday night, the 20th, I went up to the room after the Orpheus parade and found our room ransacked and over $1000 stolen out of the room. Yes I know.. hiding cash in the room was not a good idea.. but two keys were missing out of our room after I allowed housekeeping in the room to clean the only on the day we were robbed. Security director was accusatory of old friends that had spent 3 days there with us.. that I have know and been friends with for over 16 years... and they were already gone when the room was ransacked and back in Texas.. then she produces me a sheet where the interrogated the lock and it only showed the entries where I entered the room. There is an investigation going on.. but I do not look for a favorable outcome! The hotel's solution.... they comped one night's stay and one night's parking.(much less than what was taken from our room). and of course.. I am sure will NEVER admit to which employee came into our room and stole our room keys as well!! I will never stay at this hotel again! Oh.. and the day we were robbed .. conveniently there was a fire alarm pull and we had to evacuate the building!

Reviews.Title: “What a positive experience!”
Reviews.Author: missgrl
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect - we were staying here for the first time during Mardi Gras (a crazy time) and some of the reviews on here were less than positive. Yes, the hotel (main tower) did seem a bit aged in places but people, New Orleans is not a new city! Our experience - from the valet to the front desk to the room - was very positive. The room was a perfect size for us. We had some special requests to accommodate friends joining us and the front desk staff could not have been nice or more helpful. The valet staff was great, even when parades were blocking street and tempers could have been short. Our room overlooked the atrium, which could get noisy, but our room was quite soundproof. A great location as well, especially for a family with children - children's museum, aquarium, insectarium and two museums all within walking distance. Great restaurants in the neighborhood too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Get Moved to the Lofts!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpokaneJeff
Reviews.Content: Started my trip in the main hotel tower and my room was very satisfactory, was aged but was o.k. My boss who was in a different room was not happy with her room so she went and got us moved over to the lofts portion of the hotel for the remainder of our stay. I must say it was like night and day. They are new, clean, have fantastic views with huge windows and high ceilings it seemed like a whole different hotel. Yes we were across the street from the main hotel, but well worth the walk to the managers nightly reception. The lofts have their own breakfast in the morning, although no omlette bar I had no problems with that as it was much more peaceful and very convenient. The only problem I had during my stay was going over to the hot tub at the main hotel one night and the hot tub turned out to be a lukewarm tub at best. Other than that very minor disappointment I really enjoyed my stay here. Very convenient to get to the convention center where I was for the week and yet within walking distance to the French Quarter, Riverwalk, WWII museum and various eateries and shops, I would definitely stay here again, if I could guarantee that I could get into the lofts. If I was only going to have the tower rooms then I might be inclined to go somewhere else, they need to rehab all of their rooms like they have done with the lofts.

Reviews.Title: “Not excellent, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: ultrasonic1
Reviews.Content: I live in Louisiana and have been to New Orleans a thousand times and what people need to realize is that hotels in quarter just get bought out year after year so unless they knock one down to the ground and rebuild it, it can only be so "new". We stay here based on room size since we're party of 5, the location is easy walking distance to just about everything, and it's in my honors network. Accommodations can be a crap shoot. One room is really good and the next so so but never unpleasant enough to where we wont stay there again. My only real gripes are the pool is VERY small because it had to be squeezed in next to the street on property and the breakfast/manager's reception are always backed up through the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Ummm, yeah the Loft Towers are "old"...it's the Warehouse District!!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at the Loft Towers at the Embassy Suites New Orleans. We were really happy with the loft towers and found them very quiet. As an artist, I found the unfinished former-Sugar refinery walls amazing...which truly added a unique charm to the large rooms. The breakfast in the lofts was very basic (do-your-own waffles, cereal, bagels, toast, scrambled eggs, etc.) but the breakfast in the "main" hotel was great with wonderful omelets and other "upgraded" selections from the Lofts. The walk to the French Quarter, Harrah's Casino, the Rivercenter Mall, etc. was safer than most cities, we walked the routes around 1 to 2 AM and never felt unsafe. We also appreciated our "own" concierge/customer service desk in the Lofts...we were always greeted warmly and genuinely felt welcome! One day, we stayed in with our "Do Not Disturb" sign out until after 3PM and did not expect our room to be cleaned... Surprisingly, everything was changed out and cleaned when we returned a few hours later (amazing what a tip left on the pillow will do...a lesson we learned over many years of travelling!) The friendliness of the entire staff was amazing..from check-in, to the manager's reception bartenders/waiters, to housekeeping, to our Loft's concierge... We are actually planning a return trip to NOLA just due to the wonderful time we had at this terrific, unique hotel. The morning of our check-out, we were even able to "walk" our bags down to the cruise ship terminal -- no taxi fares, no wait, no fuss. We were checked-out of the hotel and checked-in to our cruise ship in less than 20 minutes! Thanks to the caring staff, convenient location, and unique building architecture/design, we definitely rate this a 5-Star experience!

Reviews.Title: “My New Orleans Weekend”
Reviews.Author: alison w
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this hotel on a girls weekend trip. The room was adequate but what really impressed me was the staff and the concierge that welcomed us. They catered to our every need and were right on the money about good places to eat.We also loved walking out onto the street and just picking a cab to climb into to take us to our destination.The breakfast was also top notch.Not continental but cooked to order.We will definatley stay here again! A.Weaver

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hour and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: foodtraveller84
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the end of January. Very good location for the conference. Also, pretty close to French Quarter. The hotel was nice. We had a two room suite. The living room had a rather uncomfortable pull-out sofa and the bedroom had a nice king bed. TVs in both room. The service at the hotel was very friendly and the breakfast and happy hour were great! Bartenders were excellent, 2 drinks at a time, very friendly! Nice, big lobby for post conference networking. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Lofts”
Reviews.Author: GE1Texas
Reviews.Content: Being on a business trip I asked for a quiet room. Beware - they said they would give me a room in "The Lofts" which were the most recently renovated rooms. This is actually a building next door and when I opened the curtains next morning there was a walling only a couple of feet away from the window. Maybe quiet but also dark and depressing. I did not think the rooms were renovated anytime recently. The corridors were well worn. Good news the Wifi worked!

Reviews.Title: “Just Alright”
Reviews.Author: Tallebony
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed two nights at The Embassy Suites - Convention Center in New Orleans. They had a very courteous and friendly staff. The hotel was alright. The food was good. Bisquits and gravy was amazing. Catfish dinner was excellent. The curtains had stains on them and was not hanging properly. The shower was never hot enough. The Riverboat was nearby and it had a variety of shopping stores and good food. We were going on a cruise and the hotel was only two blocks from the where the boat was docked. I would stay there again. Linda Byrd / Seattle, WA

Reviews.Title: “Solid Lodging - Good Breakfast - Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: PackLite2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Embassy Suites for six nights in November 2011. I did my homework ahead of time and asked for a suite in the 'overflow tower', the Lofts. My room was great, though a bit dark. The walk over to the main tower, through the parking garage, is a little unorthodox, but worth it for the great hosted happy hour every evening. A business partner stayed in the main tower. His room had a better view, but was a little dank and smelled of mildew. Overall, good hotel. Far enough away from the French Quarter to avoid the masses of drunks, but close enough to walk over there for dinner and drinks. Added bonus - there is a great bar around the corner from the Embassy Suites called 'the District' - perfect for checking out a game and grabbing a beer (order the Abita Amber) and a quick bite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Managers Reception”
Reviews.Author: DonnaW112
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little older and could use some refurbishment, but still a great stay and good location. We had a king suite on 10th floor and it was quiet and had a cute little balcony that overlooked the river bridge and the city. I asked for an inside room, some doors open to outside hallway. I have not seen this at an Embassy Suites before. The room only had the mirror in the bathroom. Could use another mirror. Refrigerator did not work but we were only there one night and did not use anyway. The manager's reception was great! They made hurricanes that were excellent. It was crowded but plenty of tables and places to sit. We really enjoyed it. The location was good, not in the French Quarter but an easy walk or streetcar ride. Breakfast was crowded but line moved fast and the food was very good. The parking was $30 and I thought a little high. Everyone at hotel was friendly and professional. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Amazing Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MrsLatts
Reviews.Content: Our kids and I stayed here for 3 nights in December, 2 nights were over a weekend and the place was packed. Took some time checking in but there were people everywhere so it was justified. We had a 1 bedroom suite and it was great, plenty of room in the lounge/bedroom area. Upon check in the airconditioning wasn't working and it was reported, while it did take some time for a staff member to come, he did fix it immediatly and was very apologetic. The rooms seem to be in an old building but have had a make over so cosmetically are really nice. Excellent location, we were able to walk around town and to the Riverside easily. The complimentary buffet breakfast was wonderful, huge variety and after 3 days we didn't get bored. Car parking was expensive but they were very efficient in delivering the vehicle so no delays there. Overall I would say it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michelle K
Reviews.Content: Loved the free happy hour and the free breakfast. Close enough to the French Quarter to walk. Close to the river walk as well. The rooms were very big and nice! Clean with great views! Enjoyed it! Would go back for sure! Perfect for families or young couples traveling with a group!

Reviews.Title: “Worked For Us”
Reviews.Author: hotlantajohn
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Embassy Suites in New Orleans. I read the reviews from other TA members, some of those reviews were negative but I am an ES guy so I gave it a go. Our stay was excellent. We were treated like VIP's from the moment we arrived right up to the time we left. The staff goes the extra mile to ensure your happiness. We requested the early check-in (granted). We asked to be placed as close to the top as possible (15th floor) and when I was told that there would be a cost for the internet and playfully complained, it was given to us free. Yeah, the rooms are smaller than the average ES but the hotel was not built for ES. Our room had that mold smell so we opened our front door and the patio door and after a few minutes it was fine. The breakfast was great (although they do not have shrimp at the omelet station) with lots of options. I thought the location was perfect, close enough to walk to the Quarter but far enough away from the noise (it's about a 10 down, 15 back after a few adult beverages). The Riverwalk Mall is about 5 minutes away. I plan to return for the French Quarter festival and if I do attend, the ES will be my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
