Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a recent weekend trip with some friends. When traveling, I always prefer to stay at an Embassy Hotel as I like the service for the price. This hotel did not disappoint. There was a big football game in town so the hotel was sold out. We could not check in early but they allowed us to "pre-check". The front desk staff offered to keep our luggage but we decided to leave it in the van and valet park in the garage. The front desk staff were very friendly, and offered to call me once our room was ready. We used the valet parking, which is a must at most hotels in New Orleans. No problems here. We proceeded to venture out in New Orleans. After 5 pm I realized that I had not gotten a call from the hotel, so we proceeded back to the Embassy, where our room was ready. I asked why I didn't get a call, and the gentleman behind the desk didn't have an answer. He did apologize though. We asked for a room in the Loft, since I had seen the reviews saying these rooms were nicer, but it was sold out. The room we had though was very nice. It did not open up to the outside as other reviews have stated, and it was clean. There were some stains on the carpet near the TV, and our sheets and pillows appeared to have some ink stains. Not sure what they were but we asked for new sheets and they brought them. The breakfast was really good except the coffee tasted awful. I love coffee with my breakfast and was really disappointed that this coffee tasted like warm mud. The hotel was located within walking distance to several local attractions and a trolley stop. We enjoyed our stay and it was a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some of the reviews”
Reviews.Author: NiniMississippi
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel, and although it is a bit old and a bit worn, it was habitable for one night, It is not the standard Embassy excellence, but I did not want to run from the place either. I did find the breakfast very good, but the reception was really bad. My biggest complaint, and this is my fault, is that we were too far away from the activities we had planned for the grandchildren (aquarium, insectarium, Teddy Bear Tea at Roosevelt). I should have booked closer to the downtown Canal Street area. The area surrounding the hotel is a bit dreary at night- not much in the way of food choices. I stayed with my daughter and three grandchildren on a free Hilton Honors night. We had lots of space, but I would choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: LeslieThompson
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to New Orleans and we had such a wonderful time!! The Embassy suites 2 room King Suite was very nice. I would reccomend getting an interior room over the ones that have an exterior entrance. Ricky and Roderick were the best part of our stay there- they really know how to take care of their guests and make them feel welcome. We were always greeted with a warm smile and handshake every morning when we came down for breakfast. It was our Anniversary too, so that made our stay even more special!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: colorado_adventure_1
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Embassy Suites prior to going on a cruise. The room was definitely dated and in need of updates. We stayed on the 4th floor. Because of the location, we had noise from the street most of the night, and about 5 am noise from the lobby area. We also were using the sofa sleeper in the room. The sofa sleeper was severly damaged. At about midnight we had a maintenance man in the room trying to repair it with a hammer!!! We talked to the front desk in the morning. They were understanding and reduced our room rate to help compensate for the problem. Overall, the Embassy Suites was okay to stay for one night prior to a cruise, but a longer stay would not be recommended

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but mediocre”
Reviews.Author: notravelsurprises
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a large convention. The hotel is very convenient to the convention center -- about 2 blocks). Tip: the convention center is 11 blocks long and sidewalks in New Orleans are very uneven -- wear comfortable walking shoes. On the plus side besides convenience, breakfast and evening manager's reception come with the room. OUr room had a small outside balcony with tables and chairs. Not much of a view, but nice to have access to fresh air. On the negative side, our room was not well maintained. The handle was broken off the shower faucet, and the toilet always "ran" when flushed. Service was spotty with no bath mat and shower gel until later in our 4 night stay. The hotel appears to try to cut costs to the point of looking cheap -- to-go coffee cups in the breakfast area were small styroform cups (maybe would hold 8 oz) with no lids. Shampoo and conditioner were in minute quanities in bottles with lids guarenteed to break your fingernails (used my teeth to open each morning). We ordered room service and our order was incorrect (wrong entree). For mediocre food, you pay a $2.50 service charge plus another 18%. Noise was a problem. Each moring we heard a loud rumbling noise coming from an unknown source. AT random times the whole room vibrated for long periods (wondered the first time about a small earthquake). In summary, I would stay here again if I had enough HIlton Points because it is convenient. But if I am paying, I would choose another hotel. Parking (valet only) is about $35/day including taxes.

Reviews.Title: “This Embassy Suites has seen better days.”
Reviews.Author: bwhit6
Reviews.Content: The ES on Julia is set up like 95% of every other property across America. This property just is in major need of a facelift. The carpet looks dingy, the rooms smell musty and have a lingering smoke odor. Regardless - it still has some of the nice features standard of ES. Free breakfast, large rooms, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Hilton Honors member so we always stay at Hilton properties and prefer the Embassy Suites. This Embassy Suites is not exactly what we are accustomed to but it was alright. We had room 1301 for three nights which was on the outside corner with a balcony and it was nice and quiet. The rooms are smaller than most that we have had at other Embassy's and the bathroom was extremely small. The mattress on the sofa bed was terrible even when put on the floor. We came back for one more night on Friday before leaving New Orleans and they upgraded us to the Presidential Suite. The suite was very nice, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was wonderful with double vanity sinks, a big jetted tub and separate shower and there was even an additional half bath. That was really a treat! Too bad it was only for one night. We liked the location away from the French Quarter although it was close enough to walk there. The Manager's cocktail hour was good but a couple of nights the hotel was full and it was difficult for everyone to get to the bar for drinks. We went down early and did not stay long. The breakfast was great and we overendulged as usual. The mornings that the hotel was full they had a buffet set up as well as the cook to order line so that made things go smoother. We did use the valet parking which was pricey but I imagine it is the same at all the hotels in the area. The staff were all friendly and helpful. If in New Orleans again I think that we would probably stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Different hotel setup than most Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Jacky P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location for the business traveler who needs to be close to the convention center. It is a 10 minute walk from the hotel to the convention center or a 15 minute walk to Bourbon Street. The hotel is much older than many of the Embassy Suites I have stayed at, and does not have the typical Embassy suites open design. The hotel is clean and has a nice lobby area. The restaurant is a little under par in comparison to other Embassy suites, but your in new Orleans so who wants to eat at your hotel? Emeril's New Orleans Restaurant is just two short blocks from the hotel. I highly recommend staying her for the bargain and location. My only complaint would be that they do not provide airport shuttle service.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Loveland, CO and Mt. Vernon, IA
Reviews.Title: “99% (overall) and 1%(our experience)”
Reviews.Author: BobandSusan
Reviews.Content: 99%: Overall, the Embassy Suites has a great staff, great location, a physically pleasant place, and amenities that were well-received. Custom-cooked breakfasts were included in the room price (along with a tasty, diverse buffet). In the 5:30-7:30 range, the "manager's reception" plied us with more than sufficient amounts of alcohol and snacks...also included in the room price. It made for a happy time. The staff was mostly pleasant and helpful. For the price charged, such amenities and treatment should be expected and standard. The room layout was spacious, and well kept. 1%: Our specific experience had these oddities: (1) in room 323 for 3 nights the toilet seal would leak, causing the toilet to run ever 15 minutes; (2) the room's only mirror was in the bathroom, one more mirror in the room really would be helpful and should be essential; (3) the card keys to the room worked perhaps 50% of the time, we were re-keyed twice; (4) the chlorine in the hot tub was so strong it burned our eyes as the steam arose from the water; the occupants of room 321 left dirty plates outside their room at about 4:30pm Saturday, we told the staff of this shortly thereafter, and the dirty plates were finally picked up about 7:30 a.m. Sunday; (5) a speaker in our TV apparently was broken to the point that voices on newscasts and shows had a "muffled" sound. But hey, we enjoyed our time in New Orleans, and the nitpicking little things gave way to a larger good time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as I remembered it.”
Reviews.Author: FJS34
Reviews.Content: The location is great, parking is a little pricey but such is the case with all of the hotels around here. I guess my biggest letdown was I stayed here some years ago during a family reunion and remembered them having crawfish for the omlets and they made beignets...this time they had neither (although that could have been a weekend thing). They do have hurricanes for the happy hour reception though. Free printing in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the Quarter, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: brendastarlet
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel couldn't be nicer, but the rooms are not what you could call quiet. Balconies to the street have small sitting areas and a view of nearby buildings. It's a nice touch, except that the street below is noisy at all hours. Some of the rooms open onto a courtyard that contains the breakfast room, which means you'll hear early morning chatter. If you can live with a little commotion, you'll get a huge suite, with a comfortable bed, large bathroom, and the very useful kitchenette. The location is great for the convention center and exploring the warehouse district. There's a Saturday farmers market right around the corner. Taxis are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, close, but not to close to where the action is in New Orleans. It is in a rather quiet and upcoming part of downtown called the Warehouse/Arts District. I experienced two extremes regarding service. On one hand, the porters and bellhops were excelent and nice. Some people at the reception desk were not as nice. The bartender was rude. During the "Manager's Reception" there were two people in line (one was I) and three bartenders. I moved over to the bar and sat on a stool as to suggest that another bartender could help me. Instead, the bartender had me go back on the line and two more people had taken my spot. The bartender noticed but said nothing to them. That was rude. He was so slow serving that I just left the line instead of waiting. I guess the instructions are to take their time with the "Manager's Reception Customers" so that not much is consumed. On the brighter side, breakfast was great ad the rooms were big and spacious. The coffee served was not best quality, but...The hotel is set up like a motel and the room doors look to the outside. This can be a problem when it is cold outside. My suite's door was old and rusty and the shower/ bath faucet connection were faulty. I did not report this as the water still flowed. There are no in-room safes and that is a drag. There are other more expensive amenities in the room, but having safes should be good. The place could also take a little better maintenance. Overall it was not bad, but some things may be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Run!!! Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlierMiles1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a big rip off. My husband and I stayed at this proprety for a recent anniversary weekend getaway. Let me just tell you that our stay was anything but pleasant which is a huge disappointment for the price we paid. The building is old and has a strong musty smell throughout. The beds were very uncomfortable and the towels looked a little overused. The girl Christine that worked there was very rude and could certainly use a lesson in customer service! There was trash in the elevator in the corner. Our tub had a very slow drain and it was disgusting taking a shower with dirty water covering your feet. You would think that would be the end of our troubles but it wasn't. When I woke up the next morning, I noticed red bites all over me. I pulled the fitted sheet up to look at the corner of the mattress and low and behold there were BED BUGS! My husband and I packed our things and were out of there in no time flat.Thanks Embassy Suites New Orleans Convention center for helping us celebrate our anniversary in such an awful way. Just to let you know, I would NEVER, EVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sailor6700
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a convential at the NO Convention Center. Prominity to the Convention center is only about 3-4 blocks away, an easy walk. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. On the recommendation of another trip advisor contributor, I stayed at the Lofts, which is a annex in a remodeled Sugar factory. It was really a good choice as it was a good restoration. My room was quiet, nicely appointed, very clean and the bed comfortable. One note is that, to me, the pillows were uncomfortable. Fitness center is adequate and maintained well. I did not use the pool. Breakfast was included with my room. Breakfasts were very nice with eggs to order, along with other typical offerings. Hotel charged for high speed internet. Staff was all courteous and professional. Proximity to night life was a bit of a hike, so if you want to go to the French Quarter, take a cab. It is within walking distance of Harrah's casino and the Riverfront.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: roadtripmaven
Reviews.Content: I love most Embassy Suites. This, however is not up to par. The building itself is old and smells moldy on the higher floors. Staff is pleasant, but I wished I stayed elsewhere. Sadly forgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: jcinnnj
Reviews.Content: The good; The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent for a convention as well as a 10 minute walk to the French quarter. The breakfast was great especially the biscuits with gravy. The restaurant was surprisingly good. The bad; The room a/ c was way too old and the noise kept me up at night, even when I shut it off. The bathroom was very small

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: WildCommonwealthBoy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton Riverside for 2 nights, then switched to the Embassy. It was half the price and had free drinks and breakfast..Staff were good and nothing to complain about the room. Best find was Roderick Smith, Concierges. Outstanding Gentleman . He sent us to La Boca and we had one of the best steaks we ever had. Breakfast was fine and rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Average for the price but EXCELLENT staff”
Reviews.Author: Huberm
Reviews.Content: This is your standard Embassy Suites. Some of the rooms have nice balconys with a table and chairs. Rooms are your standard Embassy Suites type room. They have a uniquely New Orleans breakfast area. What makes this place so awesome is the amazing staff - from the bellman to the coincerge to the front desk staff at all hours of the day/night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown and great staff rooms could use updates”
Reviews.Author: localndgal
Reviews.Content: My Sister and Daughter stayed here over Jazz Fest week to celebrate my daughters graduation from college. I had specifically requested a non smoking room -but due to some mix up we ended up with a smoking room and it smelled HORRIBLE and was pretty old. I loved the concierge -he was very friendly and helpful. The Breakfast in the morning was incredible -lots to choose from and very good. We were within walking distance to downtown -but we walked home one evening to find 'working girls' standing in front of the hotel...a little sketchy.. May stay here again but would insist on a non-smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, service, ammenities more than make up for any shortcomings.”
Reviews.Author: indyemmett
Reviews.Content: Showing some age, but VERY clean - good location - exceptional staff. Lots of goodies during our stay- free drinks (yes free drinks), free snacks, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and safe”
Reviews.Author: DebR_AK89
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at fancier Embassy Suites but the staff here were exceptionally friendly and helpful with my requests. Room was a bit small (especially the bathroom) but comfortable and very clean. The managers evening receptions and excellent bkfst make this hotel an good choice. Walking distance to many excellent restaurants and an easy walk to trolleys for longer distance forays in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “From Embassy Suites I usually expect a Little more”
Reviews.Author: BirgitM916
Reviews.Content: Maybe because New Orleans is such a touristy town, this Embassy suites Hotel did Not really meet my expectations. The room (king suite) was a little dark, the pull-out couch a disaster for my 80lbs-son. You could very much feel the springs in it. The toilet was not attached to the floor anymore and therefore wiggly. What was gros, was that brown stuff oozed out to one side between toilet and floor. We stayed Sat/Sun, but were waked up by the noise of early breakfast guests at 7:30. The rooms are not really insulated against incoming noises from the huge indoor courtyard (as is a typical feature of Embassy Suites). Breakfast was ok, but $30 for parking feels hefty. $12.95 for in-room Internet access: too much in times, where wifi is standard at cheaper hotels. if income back, I would choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a safe neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: ladymacdeth
Reviews.Content: Staff seem cold, maids try to barge in Sunday morning early, and although it is expensive the hotel itself is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: PForsyth
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for a long week to see the city. The rooms were spacious, but rather musty. All in all - the hotel was good and we really liked the free breakfast and managers reception every afternoon. The only drawback was the front desk staff... they were very rude - although the rest of the staff was polite. would stay again for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The Loft - Embassy Suites' "overflow hotel" was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: GardenerDebbie
Reviews.Content: We had made advance registration through our university's travel agent. When we arrived we were told that we were staying in "The Loft" across the street - owned by Embassy Suites. We had to walk through the back door of the hotel, through the parking garage, onto the sidewalk and across the street. Our first reaction was not positive, to say the least! However; The Loft (originally a sugar refinery) was a very cool old building - our suite had extremely high ceilings and the outer walls had the brick exposed! Our suite was spacious, immaculate and very comfortable. We had the choice of eating our hot breakfast in The Loft or going across the street into the Embassy Suites - we did both as we were there for five nights. What made our stay even better was Bernice, the desk clerk at The Loft. Her cheerful and upbeat personality always made us smile. Bernice was great at giving us advice as to where to eat and directions to places we wanted to go. The hotel is only a few blocks from the convention center...but, be warned - the convention center itself is several blocks long! The hotel is also walking distance to the streetcar lines.

Reviews.Title: “Quality in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Duke_Ward
Reviews.Content: Attended a week long business conference. The hotel did not disappoint. The staff, amenities, dining, and room where all top notch. Add in a 2 block walk to the convention center during the hottest part of the year, which made this visit a pleasure. Did not have free Internet in the room, but they provided a decent business center with four PCs off the lobby. Valet parking was $30 a day...a little steep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the French Quarter, but beware the Atrium”
Reviews.Author: DiverDrew
Reviews.Content: We elected to stay at the Embassy Suites to use Hilton Points (free stay) and have some space around us, plus the included breakfast buffet which was very convenient for traveling with young kids. Our first time staying outside the Quarter was made easier by the ability to catch the Riverfront streetcar just a few blocks away or be able to walk to the Quarter via the air conditioned Riverwalk Mall which helped with the heat. The kids loved the pool and hot tub. The only mistake I made was accepting a room overlooking their atrium where breakfast is served as they start setting up for it very loudly at 2 in the morning. Made sleeping on the pullout bed nearly impossible. Just be sure to ask for a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Texana55
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans on a church mission trip. The hotel gave us great discounted reservations and treated us like royalty. Every meal was served with elegance and a little fanfare. Excellent food n the dining room and in the restaurant. Shrimp po' boys could not have been better for twice the very reasonable price. The rooms were all so different from each other, but well appointed with a little refrigerator and microwave. The views were excellent. Happy hour was festive and fun. The pool and gym were nice and handy. We could walk to the convention center, several restaurants, and the trolley line and on the trolley to the French market. All very picturesque and inviting

Reviews.Title: “Close to convention center, breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeles99
Reviews.Content: Overall, a nice place. Staff was friendly. Internet access was an extra ~$15 per 24 hours. Wireless internet access was strong, had no issues. Manager's reception in the evening included free drinks, chips and salsa, and party mix. Floor hallway and lobby has a rather strong scent, which I didn't particularly like. Thankfully this was not so in the room. Getting an elevator can be a little bit of a wait when you are on an upper floor. Allow extra time if you are in a hurry! Room was somehow still cold even after switching off the air. Seems like another vent somewhere might be letting cold air in. I opened the balcony door to warm up the room. Balcony gave a nice view of the bridge, the convention center and the surrounding areas. The building is 16 floors high. The upper few floors are smoking floors. Streets around this area are quiet at night, with occasional tourists or locals walking around. There are a couple of restaurants nearby -- Rio Mar, a seafood place with a Latin flair, and Mulate's, a Cajun place. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Alalla
Reviews.Content: Hotel is 20 minutes ($40) from airport and 2 short blocks to Convention Center. Room was quiet and large. Free breakfast was fine. Small store sells Starbucks coffee, but has short hours. No free WIFI in rooms, but in business center. However, very slow. No vending machines, except for beverages. Rooms could use a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “As expected. Which is good.”
Reviews.Author: mikeahfi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Embassy Suites Convention Center for a convention. Have stayed at ES in other cities and always leave mostly happy. Only problem was late night check in, they just didn't care I was there. Elevators were acting strange for 5 days I was here. Crickets and ants in the room. Maid service was excellent. Breakfast was better than most free breakfasts at hotels. Room was a bit dated and worn but bedding was good shape and didn't make me feel 'icky'. Two TV remotes:one didn't work and one barely worked but I only tried to watch 3 times in 5 days. Didn't try to get fixed. June 2011 internet $15/day which I thought a bit pricey even with frequent stay status.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place!”
Reviews.Author: 2CatsMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent trip with my friend from high school. She was actually the one who chose the hotel and made the reservation and she made a pretty decent choice. The staff was friendly and helpful and room clean/comfortable. Enjoyed the in-room microwave and fridge. The hotel offers an extended complimentary hot breakfast every morning, complete with eggs, bacon, hash browns and omelette bar and there is also simpler continental fare like cereal, pastries, fruit, etc. available as well. Also very nice to have the manager's complimentary happy hour, free drinks in the bar from 5 to 7 pm. Bonus! Nice workout room. Only disappointment was the unusually small swimming pool squeezed into a corner patio right next to the street but there was a hot tub so that made up for it somewhat. Overall very nice place to stay, relatively short work (5 to 10 minutes depending on how fast you walk) to Harrah's Casino, the Riverwalk, Canal Street and the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the Convention Centre and the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DavidFOSH
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable. Very friendly reception staff and most helpful concierge. Good buffet breakfast included with a wide range of food and efficient staff. Breakfast is taken in the atrium cleverly decorated as a New Orleans street scene. Complimentary bar service for two hours each evening was popular and appreciated. Bedrooms would benefit from having in-room safes. We stayed for nine nights, and found the droning noise from the nearby electrical sub-station prevented sound sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Ewww/Yuck to Ahhhh/Nice from a Hhonors Gold Member”
Reviews.Author: oojybooj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the week of May 16th. As an Hhonor Gold member I was surprisingly disappointed at this hotel. The staff was great but the property is long overdue for a complete renovation. It's important for travelers to know there are two buildings, the main hotel, and The Lofts (located in the a seperate building next door)As an "upgrade" I assigned to room 1504 in the main building and was told I'd have to go "outside" to get to the room. Once I reached the 15th floor I felt my heart sank as I walked through a door to the outside. It was like being at an old highway roadside motel, the outside looked and smelled like it. Everything about the room was tattered, moldy, and dark. It took TWO MINUTES for me to realize the door to the balcony (which could be accessed by anyone in the room next door) did not lock. SAFETY ISSUE!!! I went downstairs, advised the staff of the problem and ......get this.... was reassigned a room on the top floor of The Lofts. The lady at the front desk was puzzled as to why I wasn't initially assigned to that building as an Hhonors Gold Member. My concern is that ALL guests should be entitled to a clean, functional room regardless of whether or not they are an Hhonors member. No one should have to venture outside on a worn balcony to a tattered, moldy, and unsecured room. The dampness, and the mold/mildewy smell indicates a much deeper problem with ventilation or perhaps not all rooms were redone after Katrina...who knows. While it's admirable the Lofts are mostly reserved for it's most discerning guests, I feel the Corporation is not meeitng the minimum requirements owed to any of it's guests, that being health, safety, and security. The Lofts were wonderful. The room was clean, newly renovated, quiet, whose decor was modern contemporary. The 2-room suite was the typical Embassy Suites we're all accustomed to staying. The air in the room was crisp and fresh, complete with all the amenities. One luxury was having wall switches that operated most of the lamps instead of having to fumble through the room to find a lamp. Housekeeping did a great job every day. The hotel should also renovate the furniture in it's restarant especially it's breakfast area. I also had the opportunity to try room service and the room service was prompt and courteous. The gumbo and grilled cheese were fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever...Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Alistair_MacDonald
Reviews.Content: How can a room as small as a match box be called a suite.........NEVER STAY HERE ....it may have a good location for the convention center....but ther are lots of other v hotels and no need to stay here. I have stayed in other Embasssy Suites Canada andUSA and this is the WORST ...just give it a miss...........not at any price. NO NO NO NO

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,Helpful,Quiet,Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: junee_ferris
Reviews.Content: The Friendliest City in USA. Always allow 2 weeks when visiting this City, as there is SO much History to See, Learn, and Explore.The choice of Restaurants is endless .Madi Gras is a Must. Allow at least 6 days for that. PublicTransport is Good. Not so much Jazz to be found during Madi Gras, but plenty of varied music,fun,and madness. You need to be willing to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Really happy until we saw roaches in our room”
Reviews.Author: moneycloud
Reviews.Content: The lobby really nice. The staff extremely friendly. Breakfast was great...happy hour ok, they only provided taco chips & pretzel mix as a snack. Hallways are dingy. Our suite was spacious and clean but killed 6 roaches when we were getting ready in the morning. We switched rooms but were constantly on the look out...could not get comfortable. We had friends staying in another room and they had a huge water bug in their rm. The staff tried to compensate us with free pizza & movie but they need to exterminate better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: richardbc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights prior to cruise, and during the French Quarter Festival. Arrived early in the day and since our assigned room wasn't ready we were given a Loft Suite on the 10th floor. I was also handed a certificate for free internet which I wasn't expecting. As it turns out the Loft Suite was huge and seemed quiet. There were no complaints with that suite, other than one day the cleaning staff forgot to clean our room. I called the front desk (around 5PM) and they offered to send someone up but I said just some towels would be good for today. The Breakfast Buffet was very good, with cooked to order eggs/omelets and the usual breakfast fare. We hit the Managers Reception every night and only experienced long lines at the bar once. We ate in the restaurant twice and while not fast, the food and service was good. As for location, it is approx 10 min walk to Canal Street, 20 to the Superdome and 15-20 to the Erato St. Cruise Terminal (while dragging luggage). Generally All the Staff we encountered were quite friendly and helpful, which to us, is a big factor in whether we would return. So yes we recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: PTOGreer
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites is in a great location, but the staff just doesn't seem to care about their customers. The first problem was with our reservation. We had booked our room 6 months in advance. When we checked in and got up to our room on the 9th floor, we were greeted with a odor of mildew and an AC unit that rattled non-stop. Then we noticed that the bed was a queen, not the king that we had reserved. We went back down to the desk and felt that the desk staff was annoyed that we noticed the bed discrepancy. We were then put into a room on the second floor that was right in the atrium of the hotel. This meant that we heard every noise from the bar, lounge and the seating area until about 3 am. Then at 5 am, the noise was non-stop as the staff set up for breakfast. The toilet not only ran non-stop, but it leaked. The bath tub drain stopper did not work. There were 5 pillows on the bed, but they were miniature size and flat. For some reason, housekeeping did not clean our room until 5 pm every day, so no afternoon rests or naps at this hotel. Housekeeping was also very stingy with the towels, allowing only one bath towel and washcloth per guest. On the plus side - the room was very clean, the breakfast buffet was impressive and the location was great for the activities we wanted to do. All-in-all, I would have to think twice before staying here again. We felt safer choosing a national hotel chain, but it just wasn't up to what we expect from Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Annex Rooms Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a tour group and our rooms were in the adjacent annex building. Annex building lobby was nice, clean and the desk staff was very helpful. Room was a large 2 room plus bath suite which was clean and very nice. No noise from the street - very quiet. We walked to restaurants and the river area. A nice breakfast buffet and the nightly free drinks/snacks were in the main hotel building. For some strange reason, long lines for the drinks (they had 2 bartenders working - I don't know why there were long lines the entire time. I have stayed at other Embassy Suites with only 1 bartender and with approximately the same number of persons and there were no lines so I couldn't figure out what the hold up was here). Although I didn't eat at the restaurant in the hotel, several others in my group ate there and said the food was very good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, Avoid, Avoid This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadrider77
Reviews.Content: New Orleans can be a poor travel value at convention time but this hotel sets a new low. You can end up in a room with no windows, dirty carpet, worn furnishings and refusal for check out beyond 1:00 all for the low, low price of $250 a night right here at the New Orleans Embassy Suites-Convention Center. I've never written a review before but have always appreciated those from my fellow travelers, so this is my chance to give back. Avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good stay.”
Reviews.Author: sampstar
Reviews.Content: Overall, it worked out for us despite having to pay the full price $299/night when we couldn't find a deal on Priceline due to the NCAA tourney games. It's been so long since we've paid full price. The good: i enjoyed the breakfast and the evening happy hour. There were some lines for drinks, but not bad for a free drink. i could do one of their omelets every morning (jalapeno, mushroom, ham, and cheese...delish). The location worked for us. We were in town for the NCAA games at New Orleans Arena. It's a walkable distance (about a mile or 20 minutes) to both the arena and the French Quarter. There are a few good eateries in the area like Lucy's and Mulates. Decent view as we walked out our door seeing New Orleans. The bad: i thought some of the things in the room could use some updating, improving. Our shower head kind of sprayed the ceiling and dripped from there. The doorknobs were old looking and loose, and the bathroom door didn't lock.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: trapedinparadise
Reviews.Content: Lobby nice. Staff friendly and helpful. Our room's front door was actually outside the interior part of the hotel and the corridor was filthy. The 'balcony' also very dingy and dirty. The room was a bit small, but clean although the furnishings were on the older side. The bed was comfortable (never needed to try the pull-out). Bathroom fine. The worst part was that the carpet was sticky to bare feet (ewe). Breakfast is the usual tasteless cafeteria-style food, good selection if you wanted to eat it. Drinks in the evening are a nice touch but the liquor has got to be seriously watered down (not even a buzz after 2 vodka tonics on an empty stomach). The location of the hotel is a few blocks outside the French Quarter. A little too far to walk and still feel safe late night. Parking is ridiculously expensive in the garage ($33 a day) Street parking is metered and must be attended every two hours- but is free after 6pm and on Sundays. Overall okay place to stay, but I would try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location just OK, serious deferred maintenance”
Reviews.Author: denver6
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on Julia Street, was an former sugar refinery, rehabbed (many years ago) as a hotel. Julia toward the Mississippi (3 blocks) has a trolley stop and 5 blocks away from the river has a St. Charles street car stop. Close to the convention center. Is a 20 minute walk to the Canal St. end of the French Quarter. Sofa bed mattress in living room should have been replaced 10 years ago, we pulled the very thin mattress off the sofa bed frame onto to the floor. Metal rods from sofa bed frame felt like they were in your back if mattress was left on bed frame. Mattress in bedroom was fine, but there were three of us, one person needed to sleep on the sofa bed. Exhaust fan in bathroom had a switch on the fan itself, but it didn't work. Business center is a joke. Three computers, one didn 't work during entire 3 day visit, other two computers are VERY old and VERY slow. DO NOT try anything other than printing boarding passes. Not usable for anything else, our Google passwords were compromised,computers must not have current on-line protection. Breakfast is Embassy Suites b-fast, except there isjust one person cooking to-order b-fast for a 16 story building and an annex. Therefore long, long lines for an omelet. another line for mass prepared scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and small pancakes. Fruit selection was good. Coffee was just OK. Not enough seating, lots of "saving seats" while people are in line. Staff: Mixed results Evening concierge was very good, reserved an early morning ride to the airport with "Big Mike". One bartender was great, another could barely speak to us as we tried to order drinks, then took forever to fill the order.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in safe, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Buc40
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, and friendly desk. Great security and breakfast with made to order eggs. Evening reception could use something else to munch on. Just salsa,chips and drinks. The decor is unique in the large atrium. Overall a nice stay. A bit pricey with the cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Left Stranded in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wjustice
Reviews.Content: We were left stranded, with two kids, on the street with no place to stay, after these awful people gave away our reservation. Do not assume when you arrive to the hotel that you will actually get your room that your reserved. They never told us there was a problem, and we called to make sure they had our reservation! There were no other hotel rooms in the city, seriously, they were all booked. So, we had to travel 50 miles to another city at 8:30pm in the evening to find a place to stay. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience in the Big Easy!!”
Reviews.Author: ginger2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites from January 28-30, 2011 and were in New Orleans for a convention. It was also a birthday trip for our 25 year old son - the convention was the New Orleans Comic Con. From the second we arrived, it was smooth as silk. The lady up front (don't know her name but she greeted us very nicely) was efficient and a very welcome sight after the long drive from Houston. The gentleman who valet parked the car was right there waiting for us. Our room was on the 2nd floor and overlooked the very unique courtyard (where breakfast was served). The room was very clean and comfortable. The pillows could have had a little more to them - they were too square - but otherwise, the bed was a dream and the bathroom was a nice size with fluffy towels and no mold or dirt...very clean. Breakfast was a typical Embassy Suites fare but they had grits which you don't always see and the bacon was so crisp I probably had more than I should have. The walk to the convention center was only two short blocks but the convention center was about 6 blocks long so there was a walk once we arrived there. We went into the French Quarter and Harrahs (where I proceeded to win $41 on a $5 bill) and the walk was about 1 mile into the very center. It seemed much shorter than that and there was a lot to see along the way. I was worried because an earlier reviewer had mentioned that she thought this was a crime-ridden area - it certainly did NOT seem to be to me. There were quite a few eateries (Emile's and Mulate's) right near the hotel and some night spots and we walked back from the quarter (after beignets at Cafe Du Monde) and we never felt anything but safe the whole walk back. There were people everywhere. Even though there were night spots and people walking about, the room was pretty quiet. AND the best part was that it had a really nice little balcony as well. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there on my next trip to the Big Easy. If I had to find one negative it was the $30 a night for parking but that's pretty much all over New Orleans - hardly a way around it. The parking, however, was quite secure and attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Close to French Quarter/Riverfront”
Reviews.Author: KGKDH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Halloween weekend. It was clean and comfortable. It is not in the French Quarter but is close to it (and you could walk there or take the waterfront train/trolley). It is within walking distance of the Riverfront shops/mall and waterfront train/trolley station. Mulates, a terrific cajun restaurant, is right down the street. It is near to other restaurants as well. As with most ES, there is a free happy hour and breakfast which is a plus. I would definitely recommend staying here is you don't mind staying a little outside of the French Quarter. The rooms and bathrooms are nice and clean. It is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, could use a sprucing up but real good value”
Reviews.Author: lsr_11
Reviews.Content: Great staff, could use a sprucing up but real good value. Very sweet and helpful concierge and manager. A nice walk to the French quarter, beautiful art galleries right there on Julia Street. Really wonderful trompe l'ouil mural in dining area. Great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BtownNative
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a week at this hotel for spring break. While it's an older hotel, it is very nice and extremely affordable. The refrigerator and microwave in the room allowed us to save a lot of money by eating leftovers and packing our own drinks. The staff was wonderful and the breakfast was amazing every morning. The complimentary laundry room allowed us to go home with clean laundry. I will stay at this hotel every time I go to NOLA from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Started off Rocky but ended great!”
Reviews.Author: Prissie1980
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for business, and the hotel was booked on another co-workers credit card because she was supposed to go at first, but after an emergency I was sent instead. When I got there the front desk clerk who tired to check me is was having a hard time with the creidt card situation,because our business cards have a max on them. When she asked the manager if he could assist he told her ( in front of me the customer) a flat out NO! I was appalled, but once we spoke the to credit card company, and fixed the glitch I was able to check in. While I was waiting she offered for me to go have a free drink because the happy hour had just begun. Once checked in my room was huge and my housekeeper was extra nice. The free breakfast was amazing everyday by the nice staff and great food, the happy hour was a bit crowded but the staff was always extra nice and patient. What I really enjoyed was the night time staff. My last two nights they were happy to help me find places to go, and food to eat. I even spent my last night in the hotel lobby chatting with them, even the night manager was a bowl of laughs. I will be staying there again twice in 2011 for two personal trips I have there because of the night staff. They made my rocky beginnings become a happy ending. The location was wonderful. My conference was at the Convention Center and it was a two minute walk there, and about a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter. The concierge on duty was always willing to give directions or give you a new place to explore, and also got me a shuttle to the airport and on my last day.

Reviews.Title: “Warning - theif employed here”
Reviews.Author: AndThatsTheWayItIs
Reviews.Content: Checked out Saturday Nov. 27th, after 7 day stay. Â Realized that afternoon when unpacking I left my camera on the bed. Â I called RIGHT THEN and left camera info, room number, etc and someone was supposed to call me back. Â They did not. Â Monday, I left another message. Â Tuesday, spoke, finally with security at almost 5pm, who acted like it was the first she'd heard of it. I asked point blank didn't you get my messages? Â She said yes but needed all the info again for verification. Â Then she said she would open the lost and found box in the morning and call me between 9am and 10am. Â She didn't call. Next day I spoke with whomever answered the phone and explained this was our 5th call. Â She said she would check the lost and found log book for the camera and call me back. Â She DID call me but said she couldn't get the book and I would have to talk to security. Â She left an urgent message for security. Â No one called. Â Next day I asked to be connected to General Manager. Â I left info it was my 7th call to their property on "Craig's" voicemail at 7:45am. Â All day I waited for a call. Â No one called. Â I called early the next morning trying to find out if Craig was absent the day before. Â They said no, he was just very busy. Â Later that day I got a hostile message from female security saying she had told me she would call me if the camera was FOUND -NOT OTHERWISE. Â  We will never stay here again. Â There clearly is a thief employed here. Â I was Front Desk Manager at another property years ago and the first phone call the DAY it happened would have set off a an entire staff inquisition. This was not our first stay. Â We liked the layout of the room and spent money on roomservice, restaurant, etc. Â This rude indifference destroyed our opinion of the place and cost us precious photo memories. Â The cameraÂ wasn't even that expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service --”
Reviews.Author: lorac1973
Reviews.Content: Staff here couldn't have been any friendlier or more helpful. The location is terrific if attending a conference at the Convention Center, and is a short walk to the Quarter (cabs and streetcars are also easy to get). Every day, there's a free cooked-to-order breakfast and a free happy hour, making this a great value for the mid-budget traveler. The only downside was that the room was a little dated decor-wise, but it was large, comfortable and had two outdoor balconies/decks. Pool, fitness center and business center were in great condition and met all our needs. All in all we were very pleased and would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DevaMobile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit New Orleans about once a year. This year we stayed at the Embassy Suites. This hotel is definitely the best value for your dollar. All rooms are a two room suite with a fridge and king sized bed. Very clean. The free breakfast, complete with a made to order omelet man. Between 5pm and 7pm is happy hour with free drinks. The location is a little walk to Bourbon street and other attractions, but my husband and I made the trek twice a day, so it is definitely doable. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.....”
Reviews.Author: c0c0d
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel after we left a undesirable one. Front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. Price was a bit on the high side $159. The free breakfast was good with hot and cold items and different items on different days. The happy hour was adequate. Would recommend this to anyone. Close to convention center and cruise terminal. Try Mulates just down the street, band and good food.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in one of the lofts. And they...”
Reviews.Author: turnersinlove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the lofts. And they had alot of room and everything was very clean. I stayed there with my sister and I plan to go back with my husband soon.

Reviews.Title: “I travel 80% of the year and was...”
Reviews.Author: Kristina24
Reviews.Content: I travel 80% of the year and was scheduled to stay here for 30 days. Because of the lack of customer service and the terrible conditions I found the rooms, I left after 2 nights. The bell captain left my bags in the main lobby and started helping customers who arrived after me. The front desk was rude and not helpful. The valet was so overwhelmed that management came to help move cars. The room I had was tiny and dirty. I hold diamond status with Hilton but I seriously contemplated changing to another company altogether.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an update”
Reviews.Author: jasontraci2006
Reviews.Content: I was happy to get a rate of $124.00 per night, but be advised of being taxed to death that isn't listed in the rate. I have included it here so you wouldn't be surprised: 07/12/10 3955030 PARKING: GUEST $30.00 07/12/10 3955030 STATE PARKING TAX $1.20 07/12/10 3955030 CITY PARKING TAX $2.40 07/12/10 3955151 GUEST ROOM $124.00 07/12/10 3955151 STATE SALES TAX $2.48 07/12/10 3955151 PARISH SALES TAX $4.96 07/12/10 3955151 CITY TAX $3.72 07/12/10 3955151 CITY OCCUPANCY TAX $4.96 07/12/10 3955151 CITY EXHIBITION FEE TAX $1.00 07/12/10 3955151 CITY ROOM FEE TAX $1.00 The hotel parking is quite a joke, valet takes about 15 minutes to bring a car around. The happy hour nights hosts a very long line at the bar for the free drink. When I checked in, the hotel supervisor was quite rude. AVOID THIS PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Made a demanding business trip a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: JoeinRI
Reviews.Content: I have had to do a great deal of traveling over the past year. As part of a training assignment, I needed to stay in New Orleans for three weeks. Now, three weeks is not an eternity, but when youâ€™re away from home, in a strange city, it can feel like an eternity. The people at the Embassy Suites New Orleans helped to make my stay a less stressful experience. The concierge service was the best I have experienced, in any hotel.Each concierge was knowledgable and always helpful. They have the travelers best interests in mind. The hotel accommodations were comfortable. Unfortunately, there is quite a bit of street noise as late night revelers were enjoying the night life. Well it is New Orleans after all. I have a number of dietary constraints, which make dining out a task. The hotel restaurant staff members were pleasant and helpful. They remembered my dietary requirements and suggested menu choices that I could eat. New Orleans is definitely a different city and has something for everyone. The World War II Museum is a must see. You can walk though the exhibits in about two hours. You really need three to four hours to take it all in. The Civil War Museum is a small museum, very interesting and can be experienced in one to two hours, depending upon your interest in the Civil War. The river walk is a pleasant way to spend an afternoon and there are plenty of shops in the Mall and the French Market to brows. Prices are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “You could do worse”
Reviews.Author: TexasWorker
Reviews.Content: The street layout made it difficult to get from the bellman on one side to the parking garage on the other. Once there, the staff was accommodating to a few special needs (a refrigerator without all the minibar stuff). The halls smelled like stale beer, probably spilled from the free happy hour. Breakfast is edible, but not great. Happy hour drinks are a lot stronger if you tip just a few dollars. The room was plain, but clean and workable. One of the large lights illuminating the top of the building shone directly into my room, but the blackout curtains (once gently rearranged) worked well. The concierge was simply fantastic. I did not get his name, but he's the only bald guy. He did not lead me astray for directions, eats, or things to do.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: shaypang
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the separate building, "the lofts", and it was perfect for us! I don't understand the other reviewers with the negative feedback. We had two gorgeous rooms in our suite that were super quiet and had all the amenities we could want. The beds were fabulous and so was all of the service. We loved the free huge breakfast and cocktail hour the hotel hosted every day. We also like being right in between the quarter and the garden district and the waterfront. When we return we will definitely stay here again as it could not have been better for us.

Reviews.Title: “We were had!!!”
Reviews.Author: TracyS3
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay over a month in advance. We were traveling with my 15 year old son and our 17 year old exchange student, a girl. It was imperative that we have separate beds for the kids. I indicated this when I made the reservation. When we arrived to check in we were told they could not meet this request unless we booked an additional room (which we were not prepared to do). We then cancelled our reservation and were told that we would not be charged as they could not meet our needs. Wrong!! They charged our credit card anyway. I am still disputing the charges. Do not do business here.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: JayWest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location several times and I find it adequate. The client mix can be scary on the weekends, and the breakfast staff is inconsistant. I have had good experiences here and bad experiences. Long lines for both breakfast and the happy hour. The housekeeping staff is very poor at communication, as it is difficult to find anyone who speaks English. Desk staff is good, restaurant is below average, but with a city like New Orleans, there are multiple options.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: barbk429
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a high-end hotel to enjoy with your family in New Orleans, look elsewhere. The rooms, while a good size, are outdated and it took us 3 tries before finding a room that was acceptable (that is, no smell, and a pull out couch that worked). The buffet, while "free" was crowded and average at best. Service was good - concierge was helpful, staff at the bar was friendly but this doesn't make up for the nickel and diming that goes on. $30 a day to park our car was an insult. I am sure there are better suite hotels to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for work and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: debpdx
Reviews.Content: I came for a conference and then had my family join me the following week. My conference roommate and I were very pleased with the hotel - great service, complimentary breakfast, and convenient location near the convention center. We were able to easily walk to the French Quarter and enjoy the Warehouse district. All of this remained true when my family arrived. My children loved the breakfast and outside pool.

Reviews.Title: “They lost our pre-paid reservation!”
Reviews.Author: txvet
Reviews.Content: A week before arriving with my 75-year-old parents, I phoned to confirm my PRE-PAID NON-REFUNDABLE reservation. This hotel verbally confirmed my plans and pre-payment. A lady described the hotel to me, assuring me my wheelchair-bound mom would have no problems. On arrival, they said I had no reservation and there were no rooms available and the same clerk said she did not remember talking to me the week before. Very disappointing! Even though I showed them the prepaid confirmation email they had sent me and my bank account showing they had already charged me, they said the reservation "just wasn't in the system" and "there's nothing we can do to help you. Please try another hotel." I was at the desk for an HOUR calling Hilton customer service, begging for help, while my parents sat in the car repeatedly telling the doorman that we really did have paid reservations. Hilton's customer service says they called the hotel themselves during that hour, but the hotel still refused to help us. Finally, they offered us a non-accessible room in an auxiliary building, if I would agree to pay again. We had no choice but to take it, since it was Spring Break in New Orleans and rooms were hard to find. Except for the very disappointing cruelty of the management, the staff was very friendly and helpful and sympathetic. The room was very nice, clean, well-furnished. The A/C was broken and blew only warm air, but we were thankful just to have a room and gladly sweated it out. Breakfast was great! Several staffers noticed our difficulties in not having an ADA-accessible room and offered to help us. Interestingly, they also offered their disgust that the management had treated my elderly mother so badly. There's some great employees but some very bad leaders at this hotel. A saleslady for the hotel discovered our situation and offered us a future 2-night complimentary stay, but we're not sure we want to go thru this again! Upon leaving, the day manager who had refused to help us upon check-in suddenly appeared and offered many lame excuses for why he had acted so badly. (He said he had been trying to contact me to fix the problems. Contact me? How? He had never called my room or my cell; never left a note on our door, email, etc.) My mom later said she had wanted to get out of her wheelchair and kick his butt for trying to lie to us. This is a very nice hotel in a great location, but needs better, honest management. Any hotel manager who would do this to an elderly lady in a wheelchair needs to have his mother slapped for raising him to treat people that way. A very-helpful night-manager tells me he is working to try to get our money refunded and we are thankful for his efforts and hope he is successful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: PoorestTourists
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights for a conference, which was held at a nearby hotel. It was cheaper to stay here so I chose this hotel. I was impressed with the rooms especially since there is a sitting area and a bedroom area with a separate door. The breakfast was good too--and was included in the room rate. This made it much better than any of the hotels my colleagues were staying at in the area which didn't have free hot breakfast. The only drawbacks to the hotel were location--it isn't near any of the "sightseeing" parts of New Orleans--it is in the business district, so it wouldn't make a good hotel if you are planning a touristy visit, and there are not any reasonable restaurants in the area. There is either a food court in the mall or expensive restaurants which makes it a bit disappointing if you are trying to eat for a reasonable price. The other drawback is that the wi-fi is not free. Though I was traveling for business, I was attending an academic conference and my expenses were my own, so I found 15 dollars a day for wi-fi to be unreasonable. Though they did have a business center and you could print for free there, which I found to be a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: RedheadVA
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites is my favorite of the Hilton family of hotels and this one presented a different option in relation to guest rooms & buildings. I chose to stay in the main building and had a room with a view of the Mississippi. The staff at the hotel were more than hospitable, and I was happy to have spent a few days with them following the TEAMS conference I had attended the week prior. Great rooms, Great Food & fantastic people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “True spirit of new orleans hospitality”
Reviews.Author: hoborose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was jammed full of people from Mardi Gras and the win of the rose bowl. The staff were courteous the rooms spotless as was the rest of the hotel. The managers special every night had handmade drinks to order with a knowledgable and friendly staff serving. Breakfast never disappointed the four mornings we ate. This Embassy has one of the best atrium"s of a chain of hotels famous for them. The suite was spacious and clean with plenty of updated admenities . We appreciated the flat screen tvs in both rooms and wireless internet in our room. We will use this hotel for our trip next year to Mardi Gras. They also have a few parades that go by the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel service was excellent even in the mist of mardi gras madness”
Reviews.Author: kycandyway
Reviews.Content: I was in town to visit family and enjoy Mardi Gras. We checked in on Sat. afternoon and had no difficulty at check in. The valet,bell service, and front desk service was excellent. Our room was a lovely one room suite. We had a frig and microwave.It would have been nice to have a sink near this since the bathroom was down a hall in the bedroom. We had a balcony which was nice off the bedroom. Couch and chairs were comfortable and flat screen t.v. were excellent. I was very suprised at how well the staff handled the large crowd in for Mardi gras . Two parades passed right in front of the hotel and we still had valet, bell service room service(excellent) and a very comfortable place to sit and watch parades.What a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: traveler7789
Reviews.Content: Service staff was very friendly and happy to help with any needs. Wonderful suggestions on restaurants and tours. The room was your standard suit, clean with nice upgrades. Easy walk to the convention center. Breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: praha13
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Embassy Suites was a delight. The staff is friendly and lively. A hot breakfast buffet is included with the price and also free drinks in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre Cruise Spot”
Reviews.Author: spny83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night pre-cruise. It was the weekend of the Sugar Bowl so I had to prepay for the room about 1 month in advance (I booked several months in advance). We arrived Sat afternoon around 2 pm (Sugar Bowl was Friday Night) and because of all the late checkouts our room wasn't ready. We were waiting to store our luggage, the luggage room was overflowing. We weren't complaining, we were just waiting patiently talking about where we were going for "snack/lunch". The manager walked by us. Then the receptionist called us over and asked if I would like 2 king rooms, we were parents with 2 20+ kids (originally had a 2Q with sofa room) I asked if it would be the same price and they said of course. So we were given two separate rooms on the same floor (7th I think) which all of us were very happy with. The rooms were very nice, one of the boys slept on his sofa bed and said it was fine. The bathroom is between the two rooms (bedroom and living room) and both had a door you could close off so lots of privacy. The changers for the TVs didn't work real well but we were only there for one night so didn't bother asking for new batteries. The happy hour was a "rum punch" or could order anything like a gin&tonic (obviously not top shelf). They had chips and salsa, and even walked around with some muffaletta (sp?) slider type sandwiches. The main set of elevators broke down for about an hour on Sunday morning and the management moved us over to the employee's elevators, telling the employees to not use them for a while. I thought they handled it very well. We stayed here because it was within walking distance of the Quarter and walking distance to the Pier. If you are going to walk to the pier you actually walk on the road that says no pedestrians. We walked the whole convention center looking for the way to the terminals and even went in and asked a security guard and he's the one that says everyone walks that road. When walking the road just be observant because this is the road the trucks use to supply the ship, most of the taxis go on the other road.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, nice breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Tiggerbbt
Reviews.Content: Good hotel if you are taking a cruise, it is just a few blocks from the port terminal. Otherwise, it is a long walk to the Quarter. Rooms were OK, good value for the price

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OuterbanksGirl
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed here back in May for my daughter's Graduation. My first stay at Embassy Suites & I absolutely loved it. The room was clean and the staff was excellent. We visited again in October and enjoyed our stay once again. Breakfast is excellent and who can complain about Happy Hour that is free! The location is great and within walking distance to French Quarter. This Hotel will always be my first choice when visiting my daughter. Bartender made Super Hurricanes! :)

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Ataner76
Reviews.Content: Given the Embassy Suites name, I was very surprised at this hotel. They are undergoing major renovations which will likely improve my biggest concern with the hotel so keep that in mind when booking or evaluating this hotel. My biggest problem with the hotel is that the unrenovated rooms are visually unappealing with old styling and many moldy/damp smelling rooms. The renovated suites (which I asked to be switched into) were on the other hand much better. Other concerns: 1. There is also construction going on which can be heard from early in the morning to mid evening if you happen to be in one of the rooms closest to the construction. 2. If you're interested in being close to Bourbon Street, this hotel is a hearty walk from the action. 3. Some of the rooms have outdoor entry which gives the hotel a very motel-like feel (particularly when combined with the old style of the rooms). Bottom line - there are other comparably priced hotels in New Orleans that I've stayed at and had a much more enjoyable stay - Hotel Monteleone & Marriott New Orleans to name a few. One last note - though the hotel is walking distance to the New Orleans Convention Center - the Convention Center is miles long. Thus, depending on which end of the center your convenion is, you still may want to drive/take a cab - particularly in the often hot New Orleans heat.

Reviews.Title: “I could only take one night in this place-worst Embassy Suites I'd ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: Roadcrawler
Reviews.Content: When I first go there I was assigned a room that spelled like mold and mildew. I contacted the front desk and I was later given a better room but the Air condition was loud and never cooled the room. I really didnâ€™t want to raise another issue. I just checked out the next morning. Thinking, this is the very worst Embassy Suite, I have ever stayed in. Thanks, Denise

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: chas1mar2
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the most friendly and helpful staff we have had in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it again”
Reviews.Author: Thealabamadude
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great breakfast, great happy hour, great location. Good room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LondonMagic101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located for all you need in New Orleans, it has a great "manager's happy hour" in the evening when drinks are free, the breakfast buffet is huge with omelettes made to order, the fitness centre has everything you need, the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are spacious. New Orleans is a great place to visit and when we go back, we will definitely be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with a baby and a preschooler”
Reviews.Author: mrsspexx
Reviews.Content: We were initially concerned about finding a hotel that would accomidate our 7 month old, and our 4 years old. We were very please with the Embassy suites. The staff were super friendly and helpful, and explained all the features of the hotel. The suite was 2 rooms and a balcony, which we found great because we could put the children in one room and stay up until "grown up" bedtime in the other room. The room also had a fridge, which was great storing babyfood and bottles, and a microwave, which is very handy! There was space enough for our Pack n' Play and all the luggage and toys that are required when travelling with children. Although outside the balcony was quite noisy, the hotel was amazingly soundproof and we never noticed any outside noise. I must also add that there was really no great view off our balcony. We faced the outside of another building. The hotel was very close to the Childrens Museum, The Aquarium, The Boardwalk Market, and the Convention center. There is also a convenience store and a family friendly resteraunt (Mulate) within 2 blocks. The French quarter was a little farther away but my 4 year old was able to walk it with minimal complaining. My husband and my 4 year old were also able to walk back from the Superdome after a Saints game. We especially appreciated the free breakfast in the morning and the Managers Reception in the evening. Their was a lot of choices available for breakfast, including cook to order omletes, fruit, breads and muffins, cereal and oatmeal. Even my 7 month old enjoyed the cream of wheat! The managers reception is a great idea. The grown ups can grab an adult beverage on the house, and we could use the hotel high chair to feed the baby in the atrium whilst enjoying the beverage! Our 4 year old enjoyed the dry snacks that were offered. If it was just me and my husband going to party in the French quarter I probably would not choose this hotel. However, with children, or even if I wanted a quieter hotel location I would choose this hotel again! This hotel really made my vacation easier!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Chinchuwan
Reviews.Content: I agree the rooms are a little worn looking, but i think the service makes up for it. The front desk, concierge, dining, bar, and cleaning staff were great. They were helpful, friendly and just nice to be around. We were in room 913 and to be fair, my basis for comparison is the Embassy Suites in Huntsville which is only a couple of years old. The NO Embassy is renovating rooms on the 16th floor and when we rode up to see the view, it seems like the rooms will be more like the Huntsville location, with larger bathrooms. My only real complaint was the small bathroom and lack of counter space, but again, free breakfast is great - eggs or omelets, bacon, sausage, grits, hashbrowns, fruit, yogurt, etc. - and it was quick and good. There were lines at night for drinks, but they had two bartenders and it moved very, very quickly. We had several drinks every night we stayed with a very limited wait time. There is also chips/salsa and snack mix available. I thought the location was pretty good, but i guess it depends on what you want to do. you can catch the riverfront streetcar to the french quarter just a couple of blocks from the Embassy. I really enjoyed the Riverwalk, which is also just a block or so, and I LOVED Mulates, a restaurant on the next block. We walked to a from Harrah's every night - maybe a four block walk, five at the most, and walked back after midnight with no problems. Go from 7:00 to 10:00 pm every night and there is a cajun band and dancing and the food is great too. Also, Emerils is right across the street. I would definitely stay at the NO Suites again simply because of the service. I think they do a great job with customer service.

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: JOHNJR72
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel last year for my family reunion. We both thought that the hotel was great. The rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. it is in the warehouse district, so it is not directly in the french quarter area. Its about a 5 to 7 block walk to get there. if u dong mine the walk, its a great location. there are little bar and food places area if u are looking for a bit to eat or a nice drink.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: wishfamily
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Embassy Suites, and this one was the worst. The concierge desk was helpful in suggesting local attractions for families and the location was okay. The furniture was torn, the pillows flat, and the view non-existent. It was okay, but won't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: zachmb
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I have earned Gold VIP status within the chain of Hilton Family Hotels. Thus, I have stayed at numerous locations, and the Embassy Suites New Orleans is not the best of the best. To start out, I contacted the concierge to arrange airport transportation, three phone calls later I was finally able to have it arranged. But to my surprise, upon arrival at baggage claim at MSY, no transportation was there. I promptly called the hotel, and was placed on hold for ten minutes to speak to someone. After the hotel had an unsuccessful attempt of reaching the company that was arranged to pick me up, they found another company. One hour later I left MSY, needless to say I was not amused with this problem. Upon checking in, it was revealed that one of my guest rooms were in the loft section, and the other in the main hotel. I was told ahead of time that both accommodations would be in the loft section. Now to the room, I was on the 7th floor, and it was a maze of turns to get to, and it was not well furnished. The roomâ€™s furnishings were old and it was apparent. For instance, sticking a bag on the coffee table resulted in a wobbly table. Other than these problems, my stay was good for a one night stay over prior to my cruise. Considering all of my issues and the hotelâ€™s location, I do not plan to stay here again in the future unless the hotel makes improvements to the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you have to be near Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: DonCT
Reviews.Content: Of all the Embassy Suites we have stayed in this was our least favorite. Our room (706)was nothing special and barely what you would call a "suite" as seen at other Embassy Suites. The pool is a tiny lap pool with few chairs, so not very usable. Be sure you don't need quick access to the French Quarter as it is quite a hike in the June heat and humidity. It is very convenient to the Riverwalk and Convention Center, though. The breakfast staff is very friendly and helpful, and there is a great assortment of items at the free, included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the hidden charges...$30.00/day PLUS extra!”
Reviews.Author: cdnbiztraveller
Reviews.Content: Yes the hotel was clean... Yes its close to the sites... Yes the food was OK. But there was NO mention of the HIGH parking costs that were going to be added to the BILL! When I checked in I pulled into the parking entrance. There was a sign there that said "Unlimited Parking Privlages for Hotel Guests" No indication that there was a fee for guests. No mention of this charge was made upon check-in even though it was asked if I had a car in the lot. There is a sign farther in the parking area that has hourly rates on it... as well as an over night rate. However, on that same sign there is a statement that it is unlimited for hotel guests. Upon check out I found that there was a $180.00 charge for the six days of my stay. I complained and even showed the desk clerk the outside sign that had NO mention of the parking charges! "Sorry, Thats what we charge for parking!" is all I got. People from our corporation travel all over the USA and Canada and mainly stay at Embassy Suites when we can... Well as of June 23rd. that has changed.... Sorry Embassy... You have now lost several hundred stays across the country per year! By the way for those of you that need Internet connections for work, It is $14.95 per day here. You figure that at $170.00 per night that could be included... I have stayed a cheap hotels that had MORE to offer with the room fee than this place. Watch out for the Hidden Costs that they don't even want to mention my friends. An added note. The desk clerk did say that the Manager would be in touch with me. Well I have tried three times over the past few days to get in touch with them.... NO LUCK! I guess Embassy dosen't care. Photos of the parking sign in question will be posted ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: metairiemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Embassy Suites for the first time, we are locals who wanted to play tourist in our own home town! The rooms were clean and the furnishings were comfortable. We were with a group so we split the quick cab ride to the quarter and it was well worth not having to park our cars a second time. The staff was delightful. The complementary breakfast was outstanding. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: msudawgs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were a bit skeptical from some of the previous reviews but our concerns flew out the window when we were greeted by Mr. Ricky himself. He helped us get checked in and was very personable. The only hitch was waiting an hour for a roll away bed but it eventually got there. As far as accomadations two nights at 99.00 and the third night free couldn't be beat. The daily breakfast was very good the only fault with our overall stay would be the size of the pool but it didn't detour our vacation and we would highly recommend this hotel to others in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: thanuge504
Reviews.Content: My friends and I are locals from the outskirts of the New Orleans area who like to visit downtown from time to time.
